loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina M. is from the village of Mangcuram. She is 27 years old. Cristina is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Cristina raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Cristina has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Cristina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Cristina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Machimbo Group

texts.en:
Saada M., age 35, is married with no children.  She lives with her younger sister's daughter who is 19 years of age and is still studying.  Saada has had a poultry business for 2 years now.  She works from 5 a.m. to 5 p.m. and is able to make a monthly profit of about $670.

This will be Saada’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to improve on her chicken coop (warehouse) and to pay school fees.  She has paid back the loan successfully.  She hopes for a new loan to buy 500 egg laying chicks.

Saada will share this loan with her Group Machimbo, which totals 16 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 
	
In the picture, Saada is second from the right in the front row.

loans.use: To buy 500 egg laying chicks

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 34 years old and married with a 2-year-old child.  Betty is commonly known for selling new shoes and this is her second year in this business.  The hours of her business are from 7 am to 7 pm every day.

Betty wishes to expand her business by adding new shoes including shoes for women as well as children.  To end this, she needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  With the use of this loan to expand her business, Betty will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will be used for better financial stability of her business.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Group 3

texts.en:
Lolita B. is from the village of Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is 28 years old. Lolita is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Lolita is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a business selling snacks and other delicacies such "puto" (steamed rice cake), "biko" (rice cake with caramel topping), "palitaw" (sweet rice cake) and more in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lolita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.name: Josphat Kauria

texts.en:
Josphat Kauria Mpurunyuk is 28 years old. He is married to Joyce and the father of three school-going children. He is a farmer and has been farming on his own piece of land for the last five years.

He learned about KADET from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his community. This will be his first loan which he is planning to use to buy fertilizer and chemicals for his potato farm. Potatoes have been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Josphat's dreams are to do large scale farming and also to start dairy farming. He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and chemicals for his potato farm

loans.name: Nairesiae Enole

texts.en:
Nairesiae Enole K. is 40 years old and she supports three members of her family.

She has been raising peas and wheat for the last ten years successfully. This has been due to good climatic conditions and a ready market for the produce in her area.
 
This is her third loan, and she is planning to spend twenty thousand to buy fertilizer and chemicals for her pea farm, and fifty thousand on wheat farming.

Her plan for the anticipated profits is that she will expand her wheat farming to large scale farming.

Her hope and dream is that she will become a large scale farmer and be able to educate her kids to higher levels of education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and chemicals for her pea farm and the rest on wheat farming

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is married to M. W. and lives in a city called Borewala in Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines.

Nusrat is a very talented lady. She makes embroidered dresses on order. She does this work to share financial burdens with her husband. She receives orders from her neighbors and charges 300 PKRs for each embroidered dress she makes, which allows her to pay for the family's utility expenses. Her husband is involved in the garment business. He purchases garments from different cities, such as Multan, Lahore, and Faisalabad (which is famous for its textiles), and he then sells the garments to different areas of and clothing shops in their community. He has been in this line of business for over six years.

Nusrat applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband's business. With the loan proceeds, her husband would like to buy additional garments, which would allow him to increase sales and profits. She hopes that her husband will be able to expand and improve his business by selling a wider variety of garments to more customers.

loans.use: To expand and improve the business by purchasing additional garments

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita P. is from the village of Barandias, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Mercedita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Mercedita has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Mercedita joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Moshina Enole

texts.en:
Moshina Enole M. is a 56-year-old married woman. Her husband's name is M., and they have two children.

To earn a living, she is a farmer. She farms her own piece of land, and she notes that she has been in this business for the last seven years.

She learned about KADET through KADET staff in her area of residence. This would be her first loan through KADET. She is seeking $40,000 KES ($500) to prepare her land so that she can plant wheat. With the expected profits from the proceeds of this loan, she intends to plant wheat on a larger plot of land. Her dream is to be able to buy a bigger plot of land, where she could engage in commercial farming. She explains that she is a hardworking woman and very determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To expand the business by preparing her land for wheat production

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane B. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for sale. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Mary Jane joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional animals. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: James Lemaiyian

texts.en:
James Lemaiyian K. is a 27-year-old farmer supporting his family. His spouse is named Virginia Wambui, and she is also a farmer. In fact, he and his wife farm together on their own land. More specifically, James is a pea farmer, and he has been in this line of business for the last eight years.

This would be his second loan. In particular, he is seeking $20,000 KES (250) to buy fertilizer and chemicals for his pea farm. The remaining $20,000 KES would be used to weed and water the farm. He hopes to be able to buy some farming machinery with the expected profits as a result of this loan to expand his farming operations. His hope and dream for his business and family is to become a large-scale farmer and to be financially stable so that he can properly educate his children and build a nice house

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing fertilizer and chemicals for his farm

loans.name: Genivie

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard W. K. is a 26-year-old married man. To earn a living, he has been selling shoes for the past six years. He also makes tents to generate extra income.

He is a member of the Gikomba Upendo group in Faulu, Kenya. He previously borrowed a Kiva loan, which he used to buy polythene for tent-making purposes. Notably, he successfully repaid that prior loan. He is now seeking another loan, this time in the amount of 80,000 KES ($1,000). He would use the loan proceeds to buy both shoe-liners for repairing shoes for re-sale and waste sacks for making tents.

loans.use: To expand both his businesses by purchasing shoe repair and tent-making materials

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta A. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old, separated from her spouse, and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Violeta owns and operates a specialized retail store selling dresses, t-shirts and ready-to-wear products in the local community. Violeta has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Violeta joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her sixth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: German

texts.en:
German A. is from the village of Carikkikan Norte. He is 26 years old, married, and has 2 infant-age children. To earn a living, German owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. His primary source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. German has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and he earns approximately 20,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, German joined ASKI to gain access to financial services so that he can be better able to engage in business activities and improve his standard of living. Notably, German already successfully repaid a loan in the amount of 9,000 PHP ($200) from ASKI. This prior loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. German is now requesting another loan, also in the amount of 9,000 PHP, which would be used to purchase fertilizers (e.g., manure). He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve and expand his business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen/women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing fertilizers

loans.name: Manabada

texts.fr: T. est une femme très dynamique, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'adewui qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. son mari est un retraité. Pour contribuer financièrement aux dépenses du ménage, elle s'est lancé en 2008 dans la vente de charbons de bois. elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 30 sacs de charbons de bois et assurer le transport de la marchandise.
texts.en:
Ms. T. is very energetic. Married with three children, she lives in Adewui, a suburb of Lome. Her husband is retired. To help pay household expenses, in 2008 she began selling charcoal. She is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 30 sacks of charcoal and pay freight charges for them.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy charcoal

loans.name: Alice Waruguru

texts.en:
Alice Waruguru W. is 52 years old and her spouse is Charles. She supports eight members of her family. Alice and her spouse have been farming their own piece of land together for the last ten years.

This will be her third loan. She is planning to spend ten thousand to buy wheat seeds and twenty-five thousand to purchase fertilizer and chemicals to spray the wheat. She has been paying back her loan successfully without default.

With the anticipated profits from the expanded business, Alice is planning to increase her farm production by ploughing more acres and also to educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to expand her farming activity from small scale to large scale and also see her children go to a better school with good learning facilities

loans.use: To buy wheat seeds, fertilizer, and chemicals

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim lives in the city of Lahore in Pakistan with her family. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and Punjabi foods.  Shamim is the mother of five children who are very young and attending school. 

A very talented woman, Shamim runs an embroidery business. She takes orders from her neighborhood clients and fulfills the order to earn income. She earns PKRs 500 upon completing each embroidered dress. She completes fifteen dresses in a month; if marriage events happen, then she completes up to twenty dresses in a month. She approximately earns PKR 10,000 a month, which helps her to pay for the education expenses of her children and the utilities as well.

Her husband is a fruit vendor. He runs a fruit shop in the market. He has obtained a good clientele base. He has six years of experience in this business.
  
Shamim has applied for a loan from Asasah to financially assist her husband. With the loan, he will buy seasonal fruits in bulk for his fruit selling business. 

Shamim hopes that this investment will prove good for her husband and he will be able to increase his monthly income.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal fruits for fruit shop

loans.name: Abina

texts.en: Abina N. is divorced. She is a fishmonger at Elmina. She has been educated up to the senior high level. She has been smoking fish for sale for 11 years. Abina is going to add the loan to her original income to enable her to acquire more fish to smoke to distribute to her newly found customers. With the new revenues from her expanded business, Abina plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To acquire more fish to smoke

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.en:
Cornelio M. is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 46 years old. Cornelio is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cornelio owns and operates a furniture-making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling cabinets and bedroom and dining room furniture to local businesses and community members. Cornelio has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Cornelio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cornelio is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand his product offerings. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Cornelio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand his product offerings

loans.name: Dominic Ole

texts.en:
Dominic Ole Y. is 28 years old. He is a farmer and supports three people in his family. His spouse is Jennifer Y. and they have three children aged 15 years, 10 years and 5 years. Jennifer is a housewife and she helps Dominic in his farming activity.

Dominic does potato farming, which he has been doing successfully for the last nine years. This will be his fourth loan. He is planning to buy fertilizer and chemicals to spray his potatoes.

He is planning to use the anticipated profit from his farming to expand his farming activity by hiring a bigger piece of land to increase his potato production. His hope and dream is that he will become a large-scale farmer who owns a bigger piece of land so he can be financially stable to support his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and chemicals to spray his potatoes

loans.name: Urjinhand

texts.en: Urjinhand J. is 48 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Uvs province, western of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both of her children attend a local high school and her husband works in a construction company. Her family has been living permanently in this town for 15 years. Urjinhand operates a water delivery service to the nearby ger district families and manages a firewood sales business in her town. She began her business in 2003 with a contract with Chandmani Uvs company to rent a water distributing point (water well). Due to her hard work, her family’s financial situation has improved and she is able to afford her children's tuition fees and keep her family comfortable and well fed. She is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase more firewood to sell back at retail prices.

loans.use: To purchase firewood

She wishes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a bigger shop.

loans.use: To buy additional provisions to resell.

loans.name: Martine Ole

texts.en:
Martine Ole M. is 51 years old and and married to Nalakiti Ntete. He supports fifteen people in his family.

Martine is a farmer. He has been farming his own piece of land for the last ten years.

He learned about KADET through a friend who is already a registered member of KADET. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend  twenty thousand on harrowing, twenty thousands on seeds, and ten thousand on planting his ten acres of wheat.

He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming and also to start rearing. sheep. 

Martine's dream is do large scale farming, attain financial independence, and improve the living standard of his family.

He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To buy seeds, harrow his land, and plant wheat

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en:
Marie Claire is 24 years old and married with one child.  Marie Claire is commonly known for wholesaling new shoes and this is her second year in this business.  Marie Claire operates her business from 7 am to 7 pm every day.

Marie Claire needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  With this loan, Marie Claire will expand her business by purchasing different sizes of shoes.  With this business expansion, Marie Claire will hopefully earn more profit and this profit will be used for better financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase shoes in different sizes

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr: L. delphine est une femme de 28 ans très dynamique, elle est mariée et est mère de 2 enfants. elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de hountigomé. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales et s'approvisionne dans les marchés locaux de lomé. après remboursement d'un premier crédit elle sollicite un autre crédit pour l'achat de maïs, sacs de mil, sorgho et autres céréales pour s'approvisionner suite à la baisse de son stock de marchandises.
texts.en:
Delphine L., 28, is very energetic. Married with two children, she lives with her family in the Hountigomé neighborhood. She sells cereals, which she buys in local markets in Lome. She has repaid one previous loan, and is asking for another to buy corn, millet, sorghum and other grains to rebuild her depleted inventory.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cereal grains

loans.name: Arwen

texts.en:

To make a living, Arwen owns and operates a service-based business providing motorcycle services used to transport passengers in the village and nearby areas. Arwen has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Arwen joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

To make a living, Levie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Levie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when he sells his raised pig.

Levie is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Levie from ASKI. loans.name: Clémentine

texts.fr:
Clémentine N. est une femme de 45 ans, elle  a un mari et 7 enfants, née en RDC (REPUBIQUE DEMOCRATIQUE DU CONGO), son niveau d’étude est primaire mais elle sait lire et écrire le Kinyarwanda. Elle a mis au monde quatre enfants, le plus âgée a 28 ans et le moins âgée a 7 ans tous ses enfants vont à l’école.

Cette famille vit de commerce, son mari est salarié quant  a elle fait le commerce de charbon. Client d’Amasezerano Community Banking depuis  2010, elle contracte un prêt avec celui-ci pour payer le minerval de son fils ainé le deuxième trimestre d’université. Grâce à ses épargnes elle a pu payer le minerval pour ses enfants l’école secondaire, et réhabiliter leur maison qui n’était  pas fini. Elle veut avoir dans l’avenir une nouvelle maison, les épargnes venant de ces bénéfices lui permettra de continuer de payer le minerval pour ses enfants jusqu'à terminer leurs études.
texts.en:
Clémentine N. is a 45-year old woman. She has a husband and seven children, and she was born in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. She went to primary school only but can read and write Kinyarwanda (the language spoken in Rwanda). She gave birth to four children, the eldest being 28 years old and the youngest seven years old; all her children attend school. This family make their living from business. Her husband is an emplyee while Clémentine has a charcoal selling business. She has been a customer of Amasezerano Community Banking since 2010, and she is taking out a loan from this institution to pay the fees for her eldest son's second term at university. Thanks to her savings, she has been able to pay the school fees for her children who are secondary school and to finish the renovation of their house. She would like to get a new house in the future, and the savings she makes from her profits will allow her to continue paying her children's school fees until they have finished their studies.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay her eldest son's school fees

loans.name: Sally Jane

texts.en:
Sally Jane S. is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 31 years old. Sally Jane is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Sally Jane owns & operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as lotions, body spray, talc powder & make-up kits in the local community. She also has a canteen inside the school campus. Sally Jane has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Sally Jane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sally Jane is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Sally Jane from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Erevgiilham

texts.en:
Erevgiilham D. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Tuv province in central Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her daughter attends a local middle school, and the son is a student. Her husband works as a guard in a local military unit. 

Eregviilham operates a needlework business where she sews many different household products and makes a variety of clothing. She graduated from a college in 1985 as a seamstress and worked in a public company until it was later privatized. She began her business in 2006. 

Her dream is to expand her small sewing shop into a bigger operation where she would productively operate her needlework business. She is a modest, hardworking woman who is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a sewing machine for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Naisimoi Ene

texts.en:
Naisimoni Ene M. is 36 years old .She is married to George and she is the mother of four school-going children.

Naisimoni is a farmer. She has been farming for the last ten years. Her farm is in a productive area and most of her customers are wholesale business people from the city who come to buy the produce and then sell it to the city residents.

She learned about KADET through an awareness program done by KADET staffs in her area of residence. This will be her first loan. She is planning to buy fertilizer and some chemicals to spray her five-acre potato farm. 

She hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to meet the demand for the farm's produce. Her hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and have her own farm machinery.

Naisimoni is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and chemicals to spray her potatoes

Warlito has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Warlito joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Warlito is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be his third from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.name: Sevjid

texts.en:
Sevjid T. is a 38 year-old widow who lives with her son in Uvs province in western Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her son Tsend-Ayush attends a local middle school and helps his mother in her business on his vacation. 

Sevjid manages a flour trade business. She purchases flour at a wholesale price in Russia and sells it at retail in her town. She started her business in 2000 and has built a stable operation over the last few years. She works hard every day to grow her business and today her business revenues reach approximately 250,000 MNT. 

Sevjid continues to build on her business experience and hopes to expand in the near future. She says, "I hope to expand my business so that I can afford to provide for my son's education." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more flour for her business.

loans.use: To purchase flour to sell

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is a citizen of Ismail Nagar, which is an area of a city called Lahore in Pakistan. She owns a small house with two rooms, and lives there with her family. 

She herself operates an embroidery business. She learned this art from her mother and is excellent in it. She started doing this work independently after she married as a way to spend her leisure time, but later she selected it as a profession. In this way she has able to support her husband financially. Her husband's name is K. H.; he is a daily wage labor.  

Zarina has applied for a loan from Asasah for her embroidery business. With the amount she will buy required items such as clothes, beads, sketches and colored thread to make more embroidered dresses to fulfill larger orders. 

Zarina is a regular client of Asasah who has successfully completed two loans and maintained good credit behavior. She hopes that this investment will bring positive change to her business and increase her income.

loans.name: 02.03.04- Bac Son- Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en: Mụi Đỗ thị (37) is a 58-year-old female living in the town of Hoằng Hóa. Mụi is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02.03.04- Bac Son- Hoang Hoa (02.03.04- Bac Son- Hoang Hoa). Mụi is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Mụi operates a family member's business, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, such as fish and shrimp, in the local community. Mụi has been engaged in this business for over 28 years and earns approximately 1500000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from it. In 2008, Mụi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mụi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3079800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 5000000 VND, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Mụi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. N. thị Phượng (35) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business, which is making and selling food. 2. N. thị Xót (38) is a 53-year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business, which is making and selling food. 3. N. thị Thu (33) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business, which is making and selling food. 4. P. thị Thu Hường (32) is an 18-year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business, which is making and selling food. 5. N. thị Ngà (40) is a 23-year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business, which is making and selling food. 6. P. thị Bình (41) is a 31-year-old female who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business, which is making and selling food. 7. N. thị Na (36) is a 58-year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business, which is making and selling food. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Mụi Đỗ thị (37) là 58 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoằng Hóa. Mụi là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.03.04- Bac Son- Hoang Hoa (02.03.04- Bac Son- Hoang Hoa). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán hải sản như cá và tôm trong cộng đồng địa phương. Mụi thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 28 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Mụi kiếm được khoảng 1,500,000 VND. Vào 2008, Mụi đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Mụi đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. thị Phượng (35) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 2. N. thị Xót (38) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 3. N. thị Thu (33) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 4. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 6. P. thị Bình (41) là 31 tuổi nữ. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.name: Tuvshinbayar

texts.en:
Tuvshinbayar D. is 36 years old and lives with his parents and siblings in the Huvsgul province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His family lost all their cattle stock in a snow disaster in 2000 and Tuvshinbayar purchased a car with all his family capital in order to operate a transportation business. 

His business is very important to him and his family as the main source of family income. The continued growth of his business enabled him to purchase a plot of land, where the family lives now, and helped him to improve their quality of life. 

Tuvshinbayar works hard and is an energetic, modest and easy-going person. He says, “I hope to operate the business stable so that I can continue to provide for my brother's education.”

He is requesting a 1,500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase car-repairing materials.

loans.use: To purchase car-repairing materials

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes was born 1970 and is married with three children: the first one is 14, the next is 12 and the last one is 10 years old. Agnes's husband is an accountant in the private sector.

Agnes, herself, is a nurse, the reason why she has created her dispensary. This daily activity is fruitful for her because, with the income, she can sort out some family problems like her children’s school fees and their other basic needs.

Agnes is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy some medical equipment for her dispensary. This loan will be important for her and her community because she will be able to give a good quality of service.

With the extra money, Agnes will buy her own house.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying some medical equipment

loans.name: Yamabary Fanta

texts.en:
Madame Yamabary Fanta D. is 26 years old and lives in Lome, Togo. She is married to a merchant and they have three children. 

Since 2000, Madame D. has been selling fabrics, jewelry, evening bags and beauty products throughout the markets and from her home. Normally, she purchases her products to sell from Bamako in Mali. 

She has requested a loan of 500,000 Communauté Financière Africaine Francs in order to purchase more silks and jewelry to sell to her growing customer base.

loans.use: To purchase silk fabrics and jewelry

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 34 years old and is married with four children. She is well-known in the business of selling clothes and has been in this business for about five years. The hours of her business are from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Mediatrice needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. With the use of this loan, Mediatrice will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. In addition, she will be able to continue to provide food for her family and build a secure future.

loans.use: To buy different styles of clothes to sell

loans.name: Akbarjon

texts.ru: Кобилов Акбарчон проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 38 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Образование среднее. Арендует пекарню, где реализует лепешки. В этом ему помогает жена. Клиент имеет богатый опыт в этой сфере. Целью кредита является закуп муки. Так как сейчас мука не дорогая он хочет запастись. Кредит планирует погасить в течении 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Akbarjon K. lives in Vahdat. He is 38 years old, married, and has one child. He has a high school education. He rents a bakery where he bakes flat bread. His wife helps him. The client has vast experience in this. The loan is for buying flour. Presently, flour is not expensive. Therefore, he would like to buy some to keep in reserve. He plans to pay off the loan in six months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying flour

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.en: Mademoiselle Kossiwa M. is 25 years old and sells cosmetics in Lome, Togo. She has been working at the Grand Market in Lome selling cosmetic products since 2008. As a young entrepreneur, Kossiwa sees lots of potential for growth in her business and, to this end, has requested a loan of 120,000 CFA to reinforce her capital and to purchase more products to sell. With her increased earnings she hopes to invest in growing her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah was born in 1974 and is married with five children. Her husband is a businessman. This family works hard in order to supply all the needs of their family.

Sarah owns a small business selling various products such as soap, underwear, suits and so on. Her business is well-known in her area which is the reason why she wishes to increase her business.

Sarah is seasoned in her business because this is her fifteenth year of successful operation! The hours of her shop are from 6 in the morning to 9 in the evening, every day except Sunday. Sarah employs one person from her community as a helper so that her business runs well.

Sarah is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more products such as sugar, rice, and so on. With this loan she expects to earn more profits which will allow her to pay school fees for her children and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat L. A. lives in the historic city of Lahore in Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. Three of them work while two are getting their education. 
Her husband has a timber selling business. He has a shop in the community area where he sells the timber to his customers and generates income for the family. He has been involved in this business for the last six years. Nusrat shares the financial burden with her husband by selling clothes, a business she has had for the last three years. She purchases the clothes from the famous bazaars of city Lahore named “Ichra” and “AnarkA.” and sells in her community. Nusrat has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount he will buy the timber in bulk and expand his business. 
Nusrat is a regular client of Asasah. From her previous two years record she has maintained good credit behavior. Nusrat hopes that this investment will  prove successful for her husband’s business and that it will increase his monthly income as well.

loans.use: To purchase timber to sell

loans.name: Adjovi Mawuté

texts.fr: K. est une femme célibataire, elle est mère d'un enfant, elle vit avec son enfant dans le quartier de hedzranawoé qui est un quartier de la ville de Lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de produits cosmétiques. elle fait ce commerce depuis 2003 et le fait de façon ambulante, de cette façon elle approche un plus grand nombre de clients.la demande actuelle de sa clientèle est élevée raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de Divers produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
K. is a single lady who is mother to one child. She lives with her child in the Hedzranawoé district, which is in the outer suburbs of the town of Lomé. She has an income generating activity selling cosmetic products, and she has been carrying out this activity since 2003 on a door-to-door basis; this allows her to reach a greater number of customers. Current demand from her customers is high, and for this reason she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy diverse cosmetic products.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products

loans.name: 04.09.04-Liên Minh -Hoằng Trường- Hoằng Hóa Group

texts.en:
"Hóa Lê thị (82) is a 37 year-old female living in the town of Hoằng Hóa.  Hóa is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 04.09.04-Liên Minh -Hoằng Trường- Hoằng hóa (04.09.04-Liên Minh -Hoằng Trường- Hoằng hóa).


Hóa is married and has 3 school-age children.  To making a living, Hóa operates a family member's business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing repair services to local community members.  Hóa has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, Hóa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hóa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3079800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6000000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided.  The loan will be her 2nd loan taken from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hóa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Lê thị Bích (80) is a 23 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


2.  Lê thị Hiền (81) is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hóa Lê thị (82) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoằng Hóa.  Hóa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 04.09.04-Liên Minh -Hoằng Trường- Hoằng hóa (04.09.04-Liên Minh -Hoằng Trường- Hoằng hóa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ sửa chữa cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hóa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hóa kiếm được khoảng 5,000,000 VND.  Vào 2009, Hóa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hóa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua vật tư cần thiết để cung cấp dịch vụ.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Lê thị Bích (80) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


2.  Lê thị Hiền (81) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Chérifq

texts.en: Since 2008, Madame Chérifa A. has had a small general store in which she sells items like soap, canned goods, oil, and other products. She is 29 years old and married with four children. In order to increase her product offering to satisfy her customers and increase her profts, Madame A. has requested a loan of 400,000 CFA to purchase more inventory. This is her first time taking a loan from WAGES.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to sell in her general store

loans.name: Hanifan's Group

texts.en: Hanifan A. lives in the  city of Lahore in Pakistan  which is  famous city for its history and culture. She has four daughters who all are getting their education and two sons who have  their own businesses. Her husband makes shoe soles and she also assists him in his work. By seeing his good work the factory owners have given him the opportunity to work for them and complete their orders. But Hanifan and her husband are unable to avail themselves of this opportunity because they have too little stock to fulfill large orders in time. Therefore, Hanifan has applied for a loan from Asasah so they can buy  raw materials such as leather and nails in bulk and and thus be able to fulfill orders immediately. Hanifan and her husband hope that by completing orders in time the factory owners will give them more business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making shoe soles

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth W. is married with eight children, all of whom are in school. She owns a house which has electricity and piped water and, since she works from her home, she doesn’t pay rent. Elizabeth wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise such as bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerycans of cooking oil for the retail shop in her home.  Besides this retail shop Elizabeth also gets additional income from renting rooms. She has been in this business for the past twelve years.  Elizabeth buys her merchandise from Kikuubo in Kampala city and uses public transport to and from shopping.  Her customers are people around her home. She works seven days a week and depends on this job for a living. Her business challenge is  transportation. Elizabeth hopes to see her business grow and to be able  buy her own car to ease her transport problems. Her greatest monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise such as bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerycans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Alassani

texts.fr: alassani est un jeune homme célibataire qui s'est lancé très tôt dans la vie active, il a appris la couture et après sa formation il a ouvert son propre atelier qu'il a appE.é " COUTURE-BRODERIE". il est très doué dans la broderie raison pour laquelle sa clientèle est élevée. en ce moment la machine à broder est vétuste et en panne il souhaite en acheter un autre raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat d'une nouvelle machine à broder et de quelques articles de mercerie.
texts.en:
Alassani is a young single man who entered the workforce very early. He learned to sew and after his training, he opened his own shop called "Couture - Broderie” (sewing and embroidery). His excellent embroidery skills have helped him build a large customer base. His embroidery machine is now outdated and broken, and he needs a new one. He is seeking a loan from WAGES to buy a new embroidery machine and a few sewing supplies.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine and various sewing supplies

loans.name: Sharmila

texts.en:
This is 32 year-old Sharmila S..  She is married and has one child, aged 3.  In 2006, she established her small retail store. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from Patan BPW and used it to purchase additional inventory for her store.  In the future, Sharmila plans to continue purchasing inventory and use her profits to send her children to school.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

loans.use: To purchase  inventory for her store

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
This is 48 year-old Sumitra T..  She is married and has 3 children ages 25, 24, and 18.  In 1995, she established her livestock business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  Sumitra has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to purchase livestock supplies.  In the future,Sumitra plans to increase capital.  She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.  This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Sharifgul

texts.ru: Рачабова Шарифгул проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 57 лет. Замужем, имеет 7 детей. Муж занимается растениеводством. Сын торгует на рынке. Сама Шарифгул имеет среднее образование. Более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Она откармливает и продает крупно - рогатый скот. Кредит берет для закупа дойной коровы, чтобы увеличить количество скот и получить молоко.
texts.en:
Sharifgul R. lives in Vahdat. She is 57 years old, married, and has seven children. Her husband farms. Her son works in sales at the market. Sharifgul has a high school education. She has been working in animal husbandry for more than ten years. She fattens and sells cattle. She is taking out a loan to buy a milk cow to increase her herd and to get milk.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a milk cow

loans.name: Rano

texts.en: Rano M. H. lives in the city of Lahore, Pakistan,  famous for its history and culture. She is an older working woman who does sewing  for her neighborhood clients. She has a lot of experience in embroidery and sewing  because she has been involved in this work for  last fifteen years. Her husband's name is M. H.. He is a butcher and runs a butcher shop in the market. He specifically sells chicken meat in his shop.  Rano has applied for a loan for her husband. With the loan her husband will buy the chickens and expand his chicken meat selling business. Rano loves her family and always ready to help in any way possible. She hopes that this investment will be successful for her husband’s business and he will be able to increase his income as well.

loans.use: To purchase chickens for her husband's butcher shop

loans.name: Menka

texts.en:
This is 43 year-old Menka S..  She is married and has 2 children, ages 20 and 21.  In 1998, she established  her thanka (statue) painting business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  Menka has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to purchase additional painting supplies.  In the future, Menka plans to send her children to a good college.  She thanks you for your support. 

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts.  Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity.  Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills.  Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing.  In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone.  With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume.  This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.  Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts.
