Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en:
Madalena Z. sells bags of maize, millet, and sorghum at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock bags of simsim and groundnut to sell.  Madalena is 39 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has three children, who are all in school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store for her goods.

loans.use: Buy bags of simsim and groundnut

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian A. sells foodstuffs in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs in her restaurant. Lilian is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has three children, who are all in school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant.

loans.use: Buy more foodstuffs in her restaurant

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta S. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Malipayon, Brgy. Banago, Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  a general store and a pig fattening business. Her husband, Roel S., who is 47 years old, works as a driver to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are 9 to 14 years old. 

Antonieta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Antonieta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. The additional working capital from her previous loan of PHP 5,000 helped her increase her monthly profit to PHP 10,000, improving the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her second loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use as additional capital to buy more stock for her general store so that she can continue to save for the future and send her children to school. Antonieta S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Shernalyn

texts.en:
Shernalyn B. is a 38-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a frozen foods business.  She lives in Palanas, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts, by working hard in her frozen foods business. She is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8000.

Shernalyn is now borrowing PHP 17,000 so that she could increase her working capital and buy more frozen products (chorizo, hotdog, tocino,etc.) to sell.  This will be her 9th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Shernalyn aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital and buy more frozen products to sell

loans.name: Odilio

texts.es:
Odilio es socio del Banco Comunal Los Ladrilleros de Compañía, Odilio vive en la comunidad de Compañía es casado y tiene 3 hijos que estudian, Odilio se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales con la ayuda de peones, los ladrillos los vende crudos sin quemarlos a otros productores, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Odilio necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de los peones.
Odilio sueña con tener una empresa de ladrillo y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Odilio is a member of the Community Bank Los Ladrilleros de Compania. Odilio lives in the Compania community, he is married, and he has 3 children who are currently going to school. Odilio makes bricks with the help of his employees. He sells the raw bricks to other producers who fire them. He makes bricks every day. Odilio requires a loan of 1250 soles, funds that will be used to pay his employees. Odilio dreams of having a brick factory and he wishes to expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay wages to employees.

loans.name: Rebbeca

texts.en:
Rebbeca P. is 52 years old and widowed. She has seven children, but only two of her children go to school.

Rebbeca is currently in the business of selling various items in her shop, such as biscuits, soap, and sweets.  She is requesting a loan to stock more boxes of salt and soap to sell.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: Stock more boxes of salt and soap to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a single mother of four children, all of whom go to school.  She resides in and rents a house with two rooms, and she takes care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, food and rent.

She owns a stall in Nalukolongo selling charcoal and raw food. She has been in this business for four years.  She works from her home in Nalukolongo and so she doesn’t have to pay rent for her business. She sells to all categories of people but focuses on retail and receives an average of 25 customers a day.  Betty works seven days a week. Her business challenges include transportation of bags of charcoal from Mityana villages to her stall in Nalukolongo Kampala district.

Betty wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal, as well as to buy bags of raw food like sweet potatoes and cassava.   She aspires to see her business make enough profits to buy her delivery van and also to build her own house.

She decided to work with MCDT because they were charging low interest compared to other MFIs.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal and bags of raw foods like sweet potatoes and cassava

loans.name: Edita

texts.es:
Edita es conviviente y tiene un hijo de 1 mes, Edita se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, los ladrillos los vende crudos sin quemar a otros productores, Edita compra la tierra para la fabricación de sus ladrillos. 
Edita es socia del Banco Comunal Los Ladrilleros de Compañía hace 6 meses y solicita un crédito de 900 soles para la compra de tierra.
Edita vive en la casa de sus suegros y desea comprar un terreno para su casa, además de comprar un terreno para la fabricación de ladrillos.
texts.en:
Edita lives common-law and she has a 1 month old baby boy. Edita makes bricks and she sells them prior to being baked to other producers. Edita buys clay to make the bricks. Edita has been a member of the Community Bank Los Ladrilleros de Compania for the past 6 months. She is requesting a loan of 900 soles to purchase clay. Edita lives with her in-laws and she wishes to purchase land to build her own house. She would also like to buy land to have a brick factory.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clay.

loans.name: Nsozi Catholic Women's, Kyenjojo Group

texts.en:
Hard-working 40-year-old K. Elizabeth has a dependable sense of purpose regarding anything to do with her six-year-old agro produce business. The devoted farmer has worked tooth and nail to keep her business, which trades in general produce sales from Karibagyira, Kyenjojo town. On the sunny side, her strong work ethic has gotten her far. Her business currently generates 140,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis.  With these modest earnings, she has been able to make the best of the bad bargains that have hit her business on occasion. She gleefully reveals how she is able to educate her five school-going children (out of her eight children) in different institutions of learning with her small profits. With this loan, she envisions being financially empowered to buy more stock of maize grains, beans and cereals as she looks at expanding into a wholesale business and improving her household income from the sales in her business.

K. Elizabeth appears at the top left in the small photo just like in the big group photo.

loans.use: To purchase more maize grains, beans and cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additonal goods to sell.

loans.name: Dionisia Leonora

texts.es:
Dionisia pertenece al Banco Comunal Los Ladrilleros de Compañía hace 5 años y lo que mas le gusta son los prestamos fáciles.
Dionisia es casada y tiene 3 hijos, Dionisia junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales que luego comercializa en el mismo lugar y en la ciudad de Ayacucho, según pedido. Además Dionisia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende verduras, abarrotes en general y carne. Dionisia solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Dionisia sueña con comprar un carro para repartir sus productos y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Dionisia has been a member of the Community Bank Los Ladrilleros de Compania for the past 5 years. She most enjoys the easy repayment plans. Dionisia is married and she has 3 children. Dionisia, together with her husband, makes bricks that are sold from that same locale and they are also sold in the city of Ayacucho, on request. Additionally Dionisia runs a grocery store from her house where she sells vegetables, general grocery items and meats. Dionisia requests a loan of 2000 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of firewood. Dionisia dreams of purchasing a car so that she will be able to deliver her product and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase firewood.

loans.name: Canan

texts.en: Canan A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Canan is 30 years old and is married to a peasant. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: San Lucia Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio Santa Lucia de la ciudad de Caacupe.
Con el apoyo financiero que la fundación Paraguaya les brinda, las integrantes se sienten seguras trabajando en sus propios negocios ya que pueden cumplir con las demandas de sus clientes y amentar los ingresos a la unidad familiar.

A esta fecha operan con la fundación paraguaya en el ciclo número 4 del programa comité de mujeres emprendedoras, emprendiendo cada día proyectos de mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de las familias.

La señora Salustiana, es una de las integrantes y ella se dedica a  la venta de pollos en su barrio.
Esta actividad consiste en que ella compra pollos del mercado en gran cantidad, y los vende a sus vecinas y también provee a algunos negocios del barrio.
Este negocio actualmente resulta mucho para ella ya que la genta prefiere comprar pollo por los altos precios de los otros tipos de carne.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas pollos para vender.
texts.en:
The women of this group are originallly from the Santa Lucia district of the city of Caacupe. With the finanacial support provided by Paraguayan foundation (Kiva Field Partner) the members feel free to work in their respective businesses because they are able to keep up with client demand, while increasig the income for their families. To date, these hardworking women are currently on their 4th cycle with the Paraguayan foundation, working hard every day on their businesses to improve the quality of life for their families. Salustiana is a member of the group and she sells chickens in her neighbourhood. This business consists of purchasing chickens on a wholesale basis in the markets and reselling them to her neighbours. She is also a provider to some businesses in the district. This business is very profitable because everyone prefers to purchase chicken from her, given the high prices for other types of meat in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchae more chickens, destined for resale.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 41 years old and married with two children who are 1 and 6 years old.  Vincent is commonly known for selling cloth (fabric) and this is his third successful year in this business.  Vincent runs his business from 8 am to 7 pm every day.

Vincent would like to increase the size of his business by adding different styles of cloth (fabric). To do this, Vincent needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  With this loan, Vincent's revenue as well as his living style will hopefully increase.

loans.use: To purchase different styles of cloth (fabric)

loans.name: Nignia

texts.en:
Nignia A. is 49 years old.  She is married, and her husband is a peasant. She has three children and her children go to school.

Nignia is currently in the business of selling bread and fried fish at the market.  She is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil, tomatoes and onions to sell.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: To stock cooking oil, tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Johnson Street Business Group

texts.en:
Augustine S. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Johnson Street Business.  He is 56 years old, married and has seven children who range in age from 8 to 35 years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulty.

For 6 years, he has been selling timber on Johnson Street in Monrovia, Liberia.  He plans to use his portion (20,000 Liberian Dollars) of this 86,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more timber.  

He describes himself as a devoted family man. His dream is to grow his business and continue to educate his children.

Augustine is holding the sign in the photo that accompanies this profile.  Benjamin is inset at the lower right of the photo as he was absent during the loan disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more timber

loans.name: St. Gozanga Women's A, Mubende Group

texts.en:
N. Rose has been selling new garments from Mubende trading centre for ten years.  She also sells clothes in monthly and weekly markets in the area.

From her clothes sales, Rose earns 400,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis.  This has even inspired her to invest more into the business. Having had a dream to own a clothes business, it is for this reason that she wants to get this loan to improve her financial prospects by restocking her business with attractive materials.

By her own account, the future of her business is promising and this will see her earn more revenue as she manages to maintain her customers by doing timely shopping for them. With the loan, she wants to purchase more garments to give her business a new lease of life, which will improve her sales revenue and enable her to take care of her family.

Rose belongs to a group of members who hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: purchase of bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of cement

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es socia del Banco Comunal Milagros.
Sandra es soltera y vive con sus padres, Sandra es la mayor de los hermanos y estudia Biología en la Universidad. Sandra junto a su mama realiza manualidades del material corospum, productos que vende en el mercado y en ocasiones en colegios dependiendo de los pedidos que tenga. Sandra tiene proyectado iniciar con la venta de zapatos a pedido para lo cual solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles.
Sandra sueña con tener un laboratorio y ayudar a sus hermanas menores.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the Community Bank Milagros. Sandra is a single woman and she lives with her parents. Sandra is the eldes of the kids and she is studying biology at the university. Sandra, together with her mom, makes crafts out of foam material. She sells her crafts in the market and at times she goes to the schools depending on the orders she receives. Sandra's idea is to sell shoes, which is why she is requesting a loan of 2000 soles. Sandra dreams of having a laboratory one day, and she wants to support her younger sisters.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es casada y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 1 estudia los demás ya son independientes, Julia vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus ventas en mayor parte son al crédito. Además Julia trabaja en una mueblería como administradora, actividad que realiza todos los días. Julia solicita un préstamo de 450 soles par la compra de cremas, perfumes y labiales.
Julia sueña con construir el tercer piso de su casa para alquilar y generar un ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Julia is married and she has 5 children. One of them is still in school and the others are independent. Julia sells cosmetics through a catalogue, to friends and family. Her sales are mostly completed on credit. Julia also works in a furniture store as an administrator. She works there every day. Julia requests a loan of 450 soles to purchase skin creams, perfumes and lipsticks. Julian dreams of building a third floor to her house, to rent out as another source of income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase skin creams, perfumes and lipsticks.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 24-year-old single man.  For years, he has been selling mobile phone cards to earn a living. He has been an active member of Faulu Kenya and previously took out a loan of 20,000 KES.  He has requested a new loan of 20,000 KES to buy more mobile phone cards.  He hopes to have a well established business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more mobile phone cards

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal Milagros, Graciela es casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo la ultima esta estudiando en el colegio, Graciela viaja a los diferentes pueblos en donde compra cereales de los productores, viaja los días miércoles y regresa los días sábados, sus productos los comercializa en los molinos.
Graciela solicita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quinua, trigo, cebada.
Graciela sueña con comprar un carro para transportar sus productos y ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the Community Bank Milagros. Graciela is married and she has 4 children, only one of whom is still in school. Graciela travels to different villages where she purchases cereals from farmers. She travels on wednesdays and she comes back on saturdays. She sells her products to different mills. Graciela requests a loan in the amount of 3000 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchae of quinoa grains, wheat, and oatmeal. Graciela's dream is to pruchae a car to transport products and help her children.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase quinoa grains, wheat, and oatmeal.

loans.name: Ica Camp Business Women. Group

texts.en:
Musu J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called ICA Camp Business Women.

She is 39 years old, married and has three children who range from five to 18 years old. She was only able to attend school through 4th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For 10 years, she has been selling body lotion, grease, crème, powder, biscuits, milk, sugar, candles, soap, bread, butter etc. in Sinkor, Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 14,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 58,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more body lotion, grease, crème, powder, biscuits, milk, sugar, candle, soap, bread, butter etc.

She describes herself as committed and serviceable. Her dream is to improve her business and continue to educate her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Eline is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more body lotion, grease, crème, powder, biscuits, milk, sugar, candles, soap, bread, butter etc.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah is 34 years old and married with one child.  He sells cereals and animal feed.  His shop is called Jermu Cereals Store. He opened the store three and a half years ago.  He also does farming to supplement his income.  He previously serviced a loan of 40,000 KES.  He used the loan to renovate his business premise.  He has requested a new loan of 80,000 KES to buy maize and beans.  He hopes to purchase a lorry for transporting cereals in the future.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans

loans.name: United Brothers And Sisters. Group

texts.en:
Patrick K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called United Brothers and Sisters.

He is 33 years old, married and has one child who is nine years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For 14 years, he has been selling ladies' blouses, slippers and dresses in Joe Bar Market, Old road, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more ladies' blouses, slippers and dresses.

He describes himself as hard working. His goal is to improve his business, build a house and continue to educate his child.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is now a divorced parent with two children, both in school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Sarah changed her business from selling bananas to selling clothing. She has been in this second-hand clothing business a few months. She buys these second-hand clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala city. Sarah uses public transport to and from shopping and goes for shopping once a week.   She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes.  She works six days a week and her stall is in Ntinda market in Nakawa Division Kampala district. Sarah sells to all categories of people at retail. She depends on this job for a living. Her business challenges include the rainy season and transportation of bales of clothes from Kampala to Ntinda. Sarah aspires to educate her children up to university.  She decided to join MCDT because of the low interest they charge. She resides in and rents a two-room house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional used clothing stock

loans.name: Munansi Development, Mubende Group

texts.en:
Second-hand clothes are in high demand from many people in Uganda. N. Florence, a hardworking, dependable and lively 42-year-old woman, was not one to be left out of this lucrative opportunity which presented itself in her home area of Kibaati, Mubende. She made a decision to capitalize on it and, with the money she had saved doing her other businesses, she bought her first bales of second-hand clothes.
With these she established her business. Although the business has had its fair share of ups and downs, Florence has emerged as a resilient lady who has refused to buckle under pressure. With this kind of spirit, she has made enormous headway as seen in the 180,000 UGX she makes monthly through selling in monthly and weekly markets in the area. Florence is a lady who likes to take a long view and she has drawn up a plan to expand her second-hand clothes business into a big franchise. With this loan, Florence is optimistic that she will be empowered financially to see her dream come true and be able to educate all four of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of using clothing for resale

loans.name: Zaur

texts.ru:
Zaur Huseynovu 32 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey .Oni vsey semyoy jivut v Baku qorode. Yeqo deteam 2 let devochka i 7 let malchik. Yeqo sin uchitsya v shokle i mama eqo polojila chtob on xodil na tanci nacionalniye. 

Zaur uje v etom biznese virashivaniye kuric zanimayetsya 5 let. U neqo yest spesialnoye mesto qde on ostavlyayet kuric . Seychas on nujdayestya v 2000 AZN chtobi  kupit novix kurit i korm dlya nix .Tak kak seychas leto v Baku ludi yedat bolshe kuricu  i poetomu on bi xotel uvelichit ix kolichestvo.
texts.en:
Zaur H. is 32 years old. He is married and has two children. Their family lives in the city of Baku. His children are two year old daughter and seven year old son. His son goes to school and his mother also enrolled him in a dancing school so he can learn the national dance. Zaur has been in the business of growing chickens for five years. He has a place where he keeps the chickens. At this time he needs 2,000 AZN to buy new chickens and food for them. In the summer time in Baku people eat chicken more so he wants to increase the quantity.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens and food

loans.name: Women Of Faith Group

texts.en:
Theresa T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Women Of Faith. She is 51 years old, widowed, and has five children aged from 12 to 26. She was only able to attend school through 8th grade due to lack of financial support.
For the last six years, Theresa has been selling charcoal in Sinkor, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 9,000 LRD portion of this 37,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of charcoal.
Theresa describes herself as willing to serve. Her dream is to improve her business and continue to support her family so that it can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Nyamuhanami Twimukye, Mubende Group

texts.en:
K. Joseph's main source of livelihood for the past 20 years has been running an agricultural farm in Nyamuhanami, Mubende. It is with earnings from this business that hardworking Joseph has managed to sustain his family of eight children. The 46-year-old dynamic businessman has reached a point where his business profits now amount to 200,000 UGX per month. With steady progress in building his small enterprise, Joseph reckons his future prospects are improving with every passing day.
With a loan coming his way, Joseph has the conviction that he will be able to improve his farming system with fertilizers to produce more cash crops such as maize, cassava, peanuts and beans, so that he does not run short of supplies for his customers. This will improve his sales revenues and enable him to live a self-sustaining life. He hopes to be able to educate his children and see them become important people who can support themselves in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel M. Riveros es una señora de 65 años  y  tiene 4 hijos, todos mayores de edad y ya con familias independientes. 
Se dedica a la costura desde hace 40 años, dicha actividad la desarrollo en diversas situaciones, ya sea trabajando para otras personas, como en los primeros tiempos o desarrollando un emprendimiento propio, como lo hizo Ysabel hace 20 años. 
Luego de trabajar por mucho tiempo como empleada de fabricas de ropas, Ysabel pudo comprar una maquina de coser y empezar de esa manera un trabajo independiente, al correr de los años pudo formar un pequeño taller de costuras.
El crédito obtenido de la Fundación Paraguaya, lo ha invertido en el mejoramiento de su salón de trabajo, que con el crecimiento del emprendimiento ha ido quedando chico. Ysabel agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ysabel M. Riveros is 65 years old and has 4 children, all of whom are independent and have their own families. She has been a seamstress for 40 years and has developed this skill through many different working situations. She worked for others in the early stages of her vocation and launched her own business 20 years ago. After working for some time as an employee in a clothing factory, Ysabel was able to buy a sewing machine and in this way begin working independently. Through the years, she was able to start her own little sewing workshop. She invested the credit that she received from Fundación Paraguaya in improving her workspace, which with the growth of her business became too small. Ysabel is grateful for the support that Fundación Paraguaya has offered her.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To refurbish her workspace

loans.name: Faig

texts.ru:
Faig jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Emu 42 qoda. On pereselenec iz Agdama okuppirovannaya teritoriya Karabaxa i seychas jivet v Baku. Eqo deti uchatsya v shkole i zanimayutsya muzikoy. 

Faig Muxtarov v etom biznese prodaji odejdi uje 7 let. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit novuyu odejdu  ved vperedi idet osen i shkola  i on xohceh kupit osenniye veshi i odejdu detyam malchikam dlya shkoli dlya pereprodaji.
texts.en:
Faig is married and has two children. He is 42 years old. He has relocated from Agdam which is an occupied Karabah territory and now lives in Baku. His children go to school and also take music classes. Faig M. has been in the business of selling clothing for seven years. At this time he needs 2000 AZN to buy new clothing to prepare for the autumn and school season and he wants to buy seasonal school clothes for boys.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new merchandise for resale

loans.name: John

texts.en:
M. John is 40 years old and runs a formidable business venture in the form of a general store in Ikoba trading centre, Kyenjojo. This business enables him to earn money to meet his daily needs.
It is always difficult for many people in this area to settle and create their own livings. This leads many to spend time drinking alcohol and gambling. However John is different. His economic obligations and responsibility to his seven children and family have made him settle for business.
John used the small capital from his previous transportation business to start his retail shop, which now brings in 120,000 UGX monthly. He is seeking a loan to expand his business by purchasing more stock since there is ready market from customers. He is also looking at setting up a fuel pump station when he gets enough capital in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is married with two children. He is an entrepreneur from Stryi who runs a food sales business in his home town. After recession hit Ukraine many people cut their expenses. However, groceries are a basic need for any family, which is why they still sell well. Igor finds favor with all his customers and has been working in this sphere of business for four years.
Igor is seeking a loan of 17,000 UAH to increase his capital. He is a businessman who sees an opportunity for business growth. This loan will be a big help to him as he looks for ways to increase his business activity.

loans.use: To increase his capital

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is an entrepreneur from Kamenka who is married with two children. She runs a retail business selling cement, sacks for vegetables and grain, and empty glass containers for canning. She also leases concrete mixers to local farmers and construction workers. She operates her business from home. Natalya’s house is located at a busy road where there is much traffic. Passing drivers stop by when they see the sign and buy from Natalya.
Natalya started her business ten years ago. Currently, her turnover capital amounts to 45,000 UAH. Her net income amounts to 5,000 UAH per month. Natalya has recently purchased two new concrete mixers to lease out. She is requesting a loan of 6,064 UAH to purchase 1,000 three-liter glass jars for resale. Natalya works hard to provide for her family. She is a very good mother trying to make sure her children have all the necessary things. Her younger daughter has cerebral palsy and Natalya does everything she can to help her daughter have a normal and happy life.

loans.use: To purchase 1,000 three-liter (0.66 gallon) glass jars

loans.name: Help The Poor Group

texts.en:
Lorpu W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Help The Poor. She is 59 years old, single and has three children aged from 32 to 42. She was only able to attend school through 8th grade due to lack of financial support. Lorpu cares for one sibling.
For the past three years, Lorpu has been operating a mini restaurant on Lynch Street, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more rice, meat, fish, cooking oil, beans etc. Lorpu describes herself as hardworking. Her goal is to improve her business and continue to support her family so that they can have a better future.
In the photo that accompanies this profile, Deddeh is inset lower right because she was absent during the loan disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more rice, meat, fish, cooking oil, beans etc.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru:
Anvar agayevu 22 qoda. On ne jinat i jivet so svoyey semyoy  v qorede Baku. On uchitsya v universitete v zaochnom fakultete bioloqii. Etobu biznesu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo papai i poetomu postupil na biloqa.On ochen lubit rasteniya i lubit uxajivat za nimi polevat ix rezat otrastki. 

Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit sajenci novix cvetov kotorix u neqo net i kotorix net v Baku.Tak je on v budushem xotelbi imet bolshe mesta dlya toqo chtob xranit eti rasteniya.
texts.en:
Anvar A. is 22 year old. He is not married and lives with his family in the city of Baku. He is studying at the university in the extramural biology department. He learned this business from his father and this is why he wants to be a biologist. He loves plants and loves taking care of them, to water and trim them. At this time he needs 2000 AZN to buy seedlings of flowers which do not grow in Baku. In the future he also wants to have more space so he can preserve these plants.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flower seedlings

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan sells second-hand clothes and children's shoes. He is a member of Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, and has previously serviced five loans. These have helped him add stock to his business hence improving the business. His living standards have also improved and he can afford to pay school fees for his children.
Jonathan is requesting a new loan of 90,000 KES to purchase stock of clothes and shoes. He has been running his business for seven years and hopes to open other outlets in the future.

loans.use: To purchase stock of clothes and shoes

loans.name: Candy Natalli

texts.es: La Sra. Candy se dedica a la venta de tucumanas, empanadas con relleno de carne molida y condimentos, acompañados de salsas, en el mercado de la zona de San Antonio Alto, y tiene también un puesto donde varios productos como juguetes, regalos, cosmeticos, y otros. Aprendió esta actividad de su mamá ya que ella vende desde hace muchos años. Ella y su familia son muy conocidos por la zona ya que viven en la misma zona. Vive en la casa de sus abuelos con sus papás y sus hermanos, que ya son independientes. El crédito será invertido en la compra de juguetes, cosméticos y dulces para el bazar.
texts.en:
Candy dedicates herself to selling tucumanas, empanadas filled with ground beef and seasoning, accompanied with sauces. She sells them in the market in the neighbourhood of San Antonio Alto. She also has a stand where she sells various products such as toys, gifts, cosmetics, etc. She learned this business from her mother, who has been a saleswoman for many years. Candy and her family are well known in the area where they sell their goods since they live in the same area. Candy lives in her grandparents’ home with her parents and siblings, who are independent. This credit will be invested in purchasing toys, cosmetics, and sweets to sell in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Anne R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gifts and toys to sell in the market

loans.name: God’S Wonders Group

texts.en:
Meakel D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God’s Wonders. She is 62 years old, married and has five children aged from 27 to 39 years old. She did not have the privilege of attending school due to poverty. For the past ten years, she has been selling dried fish in Thinkers Village Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.
Meakel plans to use her 8,000 LRD portion of this 40,000 LRD group loan to buy more fish. She describes herself as a caring woman. Her goal is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish

loans.name: Eron

texts.en:
Eron is a single mother of ten children, six of whom go to school. She also takes care of one additional family member. Eron rents a two-roomed house with no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, food and rent.
Eron owns a stall in Naguru selling second-hand clothes. She buys bales of second-hand clothes from traders in Nabugabo Road in Kampala city. She uses public transport to and from the traders and visits them once every two weeks. She wants to use this loan of 800,000 UGX to buy more bales of second-hand clothes for her business.
Eron doesn’t pay rent for her business but she does pay monthly market dues. She has been in this business for over 18 years. She sells retail to all categories of people. She works six days a week and, besides this clothing business, she also rears chickens at her home. Her business challenge is the rainy season as she works from an open place.
Eron's aspiration is to start to import bales of second-hand clothes herself. She joined Kiva partner, MCDT, because of the low interest charged.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ayshen

texts.ru:
Ayshen ne zamujem  i jivet so svoimi roditelyami. Ona jivet v qorode Baku. Yey 20 let .ona uchitsya v univere na zaochnom fakultete u neyo universitet platniy ona rabotayet chtobi oplatit universitet. 

Seycahs ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit moyushiye sredstva dlya pereprodaji. V etom biznese prodaji shampunet milo balzamov i t.d ona uje 2 qoda.
texts.en:
Ayshen is not married and lives with her children. She lives in the city of Baku. She is twenty years old and is studying in the university in extramural department. She has to pay for the university and works so she can pay her tuition. At this time she needs 2000 AZN to buy hygiene supplies for resale. She has been in the business of selling shampoo, soap, oils, and other products for two years.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hygiene products

loans.name: Cavidu

texts.ru:
Cavidu 22 qoda . On ne jinat i jivet v qorode Baku. On ne uchitsya v univere on reshil prodoljit professiyu dedushki kotoriy s detsva uchil emu remeslennichestvo.

Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZn chtobi kupit novyu aparaturu tak kak eta aparatura emu ostalas ot dedushki i ona uje staraya.on xechesh noviy aparat chtobi uludshit biznes .
texts.en:
Cavidu is 22 years old. He is not married and lives in the city of Baku. He is not going to the university and decided to take his grandfather's profession which he taught him when Cavidu was very young. At this time he needs 2000 AZN to buy new equipment because his equipment was his grandfather's and is very old. He wants to buy this new machinery to improve his business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new equipment

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: El Sr. Walter es un cliente muy antiguo y muy responsable que trabaja con nuestra institución, se dedica al rubro del transporte, tiene una movilidad con la cual trabaja con servicio de radiotaxi. Tiene su casita propia en la zona de Villa Litoral, es casado y tiene seis hijos que ya son independientes y cada uno con su familia. El cliente tiene mas de 20 años con esta actividad por que tiene mucha experiencia en su negocio.Tiene una segunda movilidad que trabaja con chofer y el recibe la renta diaria, de esta movilidad pago la mitad al contado y le falta cancelar un saldo, el crédito que solicita ahora es para esta inversión ya que desea pagar el monto completo de la movilidad, es muy trabajador saco a toda su familia adelante, esta muy agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Walter is a longstanding and very responsible client that works with our institution. He is dedicated to the transportation industry, and has a vehicle that he uses for his radio taxi service. He has his own little house in the district of Villa Litoral. He is married and has six children that are independent, each with their own family. The client has worked in transportation for more than 20 years, so he has a lot of experience with his business. He has a second vehicle with a driver who Walter typically pays daily, but he needs to pay a balance for the taxi. The credit that he is requesting now is for this investment given that he would like to pay the full amount for the taxi. His very hardworking and has helped his entire family to get ahead. He is very thankful for the institution and the support it has offered him.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay a balance on a taxi

loans.name: Maria Gricelda

texts.es:
La Sra. María B. tiene 27 años, tiene 3 hijos menores  una nena de 6 años y un par de gemelos de 5 años, todos ya en edad escolar, ella está en pareja hace 13 años con el Sr. Reinaldo Osmar Espínola. 
Ella había venido desde chiquita del interior con su madre quien en ese entonces se había separado, y vinieron a probar suerte aquí en Asunción, su madre entró a trabajar en casa de familia, y de a poco se fue independizándose y empezó en la venta de mercerías y luego de comestibles.
Ella también desde chica, ha aprendido con su madre el ser comerciante, y luego se decidió a abrir un pequeño restauran para vender bebidas, para más tarde habilitar un comedor también y para atraer a más clientes compró mesas de billar y de pool.
Con este crédito piensa comprar un congelador para enfriar sus bebidas porque sólo contaba con una heladera y ya no le abastecía.
texts.en:
María B. is 27 years old and has three young children--a girl of six and a pair of five year old twins--all of whom are school age. She has been with her partner Reinaldo Osmar Espínalo for 13 years.

She has come far from the young girl who came to try her luck here in Asunción with her mother who was then separated from her husband. Her mother went to work in the house of another family and little by little she became independent and began to sell sewing and haberdashery items and later foodstuffs.

Since she was girl she had been learning from her mother how to be a merchant and she decided to open a small restaurant to sell drinks. Later she enlarged the room and brought more customers in with billiard and pool tables. With this loan she will buy a freezer to keep the drinks cold because she only has one fridge which no longer holds everything.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: A freezer for her beverages

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 23 años de edad reside en Lolotiquillo, departamento Morazán, es madre soltera tiene dos hijos de 3 y 2 años, vende frutas y  refrescos.
Tiene un año de manejar el negocio, el cual esta ubicado en la casa de habitación  la ventaja es que esta un centro escolar muy cerca  y los alumnos en su mayoría compran productos a Maritza, está solicitando un préstamo para comprar: frutas, bebidas carbonatadas, boquitas, dulces. Esto dinero ayudara a tener producto nuevos para sus clientes y mejorar los ingresos.
Las aspiraciones son tener un tienda con variedad productos que ofrecer para mejorar la condición de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maritza is 23 years old and resides in Lolotiquillo, Department of Morazán. She is a single mother with two children, ages 3 and 2. Maritza sells fruits and soft drinks.

She has managed her business for one year. It is located in her house, which has an advantageous location near a school. Most of the customers who buy her products are students. She is requesting a loan to buy fruits, carbonated beverages, snacks, and candy. The money will help her have new products for her customers and improve her revenues.

Her aspirations include having a store with a variety of products to offer so that she can improve the living conditions of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits, carbonated beverages, snacks, and candy

loans.name: Enmanuel 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group Emmanuel 2 & 3 (Emmanuel). She began with Kiva partner, Esperanza, because she wanted to start a business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity. Maria makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and four children.
Maria has run her business for over six years, starting with her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying fruits and vegetables such as avocados, bananas, oranges, mangoes, etc. She is excited to be taking her 12th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She will use her profits to buy school supplies and uniform for her children, improve her business and progress. She says that her most difficult challenge is to progress in her business. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to cook.

loans.use: To buy all kind of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es: La Sra. Mariana Vive en la localidad D. el torno distante a 39 km D. la ciudad D. santa cruz, en la comunidad D. Santa Martha, su actividad principal es la venta D. ropa  en el mercado D. el torno, D. forma ambulante, su esposo es chofer D. camiones y se ausenta D. la casa por varias semanas, el cual una vez al mese esta con su familia, tienen que trabar duro ya que tienen 5 hijos en edad escolar lo cual le genera un costo elevado ya sea en el estudio y también en salud, hace 10 año que vive en su propio domicilio el cual han tenido que pasar muchas necesidades para adquirirlo ya que lo compraron con el poco dinero que tenían, el dinero D. crédito lo utilizara en compra D. Chamarras y Chompas ya que esta haciendo mucho frio y la Sra. Tiene muchos pedidos en esta época D. invierno
texts.en:
Sra. Mariana lives in the Santa Martha community of El Torno neighborhood, which is 39 km from the city of Santa Cruz. Her main business is selling clothing as a street vendor in El Torno's market. Her husband is a truck driver and is gone from the house for weeks at a time, returning once a month to be with the family. They have to work hard since they have 5 school-aged children, which is quite costly both in terms of schooling and health care. For ten years they have lived in their own home. They had to give up a lot of necessities in order to acquire their house, which they purchased with the little money they had. The money from the loan will be used to purchase winter coats and sweaters, since it's been very cold and the Sra. has a lot of orders this wintertime.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase winter jackets and sweaters

loans.name: Querer Es Poder Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Querer es Poder” es conformado por 17 socias pertenecientes a la ciudad de  Rancagua.
Palmenia es la presidenta de este grupo, en la foto se encuentra a la izquierda, en 3º fila y viste un suéter blanco con figuras color negro y rojo. Ella tiene en  su casa una paquetería y librería y  además  vende comida rápida para llevar en la  casa  de al lado, la cual arrienda. Su hijo de 15 años y su marido, cuando llega del trabajo, le ayudan a atender los negocios. También tiene 3 hijos más, unos mellizos de 9 años y una pequeña de 4 años. Palmenia y su marido empezaron estos negocios hace 2 años, cuando su marido empeoró la visión de un ojo, lo cual era fundamental para el trabajo que realizaba como analista de sistemas. Fue entonces que tuvo que dejar su trabajo y ambos decidieron iniciar estos negocios con ayuda económica  de su suegro. Sin embargo, afortunadamente su marido pudo retomar su trabajo después, pero ella siguió con ambos negocios. 
Con este préstamo Palmenia comprará mercadería para sus negocios.
Su sueño es comprar la casa que arrienda y ampliarse para desarrollar sus actividades.. 
Esta muy contenta por el apoyo que recibe de Fondo Esperanza y de su grupo de trabajo del cual ha aprendido mediante las experiencias de sus compañeras.

Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O’higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 Km. de túneles.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Querer de Poder” is comprised of 17 members from the city of Rancagua.

Palmenia is the group president. In the photograph, she is seated on the third row to the left wearing a white jacket with red and black bands. She operates a parcel shipping center and bookstore out of her home. In addition, she sells fast food next to her house which she is renting. Her 15 year old son and her husband, when he comes home from work, help manage her businesses. Palmenia has three more children, 9 year old twins and a 4 year old daughter. She and her husband began these businesses two years ago when her husband began losing vision in one eye, which is essential for his job as a systems analyst. He then quit his job and both of them decided to start these business with financial assistance from her father-in-law. Fortunately, her husband later returned to his job but she continued to manage both businesses. With this loan, Palmenia will by merchandise for her businesses.

Her dream is to buy the house that she is renting and expand it so that she can develop her businesses. She is very happy with the support she has received from Fondo Esperanza and her Communal Bank. Palmenia has learned from the experiences of her fellow group members.

Rancagua is part of the Libertador Bernardo O’Higgins region. This modern city is one of the main producers and exporters of fruits and wine in Chile. It is also a mining city because it is the home of “El Teniente”, one of the largest underground mines in the world with 4500km of tunnels.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for a bookstore & parcel shipping business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 54 años, vive con su esposo y el último D. sus hijos. DesD. hace 6 años decidió explotar al máximo los recursos que tiene en sus terrenos, que son hechos D. arcilla, esto le facilitó mucho para la producción D. ladrillos, desD. entonces produce en masa, además tuvo la necesidad D. contratar mano D. mano D. obra, en especial D. personas expertas para el proceso D. fabricación. En cuanto a la comercialización ella personalmente se encarga D. esa actividad, ofreciéndolo a varios puntos D. la ciudad. Al mes venD. un promedio D. 20 millares D. ladrillos que le sirve para solventar los gastos familiares. Afirma que su negocio es rentable porque los ladrillos tienen mucha demanda en el mercado, es por eso que se proyecta a futuro tener más extensiones D. tierra arcillosa para continuar fabricando mayor cantidad D. ladrillos. Es su décimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, le servirá para la compra D. materiales que necesita para la fabricación D. ladrillos.
texts.en:
Francisca is 54 years old. She lives with her husband and the youngest of their children. Six years ago, she decided to exploit as much as possible the resources she has in her land, which is rich in clay. This was very good for making bricks. Since then she has mass-produced them. She also needed to hire labor, especially people who are experts in brickmaking. As for marketing, she takes care of it herself, offering her bricks for sale at several places in the city. She sells on average 20,000 bricks per month, which helps her cover family expenses. She says her business is profitable because there is high demand for bricks; for this reason she plans to buy more clay-rich land in the future so she can continue making more bricks. This is Francisca's tenth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support since she has always shown herself to be responsible about her payments. She is also grateful to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible people and are very supportive. She thanks the people who will be managing the loan she is requesting, and the loan will be very helpful to her in her business's progress. The loan she is requesting will help her buy materials she needs for brickmaking.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of brickmaking materials

loans.name: Monica Francisco

texts.pt:
MONICA FRANCISCO L. nasceu e cresceu em Maputo num dos bairros periféricos onde fez o seu ensino primário frequentando actualmente o ensino superior.
Na sua infância além de estudar, ajudava o seu pai na sua loja facto que lhe fez ganhar experiencia nesta área de negócio, onde depois abriu um salão de beleza e depois no ano 2000 passou a fazer negócio de sapatos usados.
Através de amigas e clientes da Hluvuku, ficou a saber da existência desta instituição e como queria fazer crescer o seu negócio, foi solicitar um empréstimo no valor de 15.000,00mt com o qual pretende comprar fardo de sapatos de homens, mulheres e crianças para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto assim como sua receita melhorando também a sua vida e da sua família.
O seu sonho futuro e de concluir o ensino superior e se tornar numa grande empresaria. Para tal pretende solicitar mais empréstimos.
texts.en:
Monica Francisco was born and raised in suburbs of Maputo where she went to elementary school. She is currently in college. During her childhood, apart from studying she helped her father in his store which has made her gain experience in the business. Later she opened a beauty salon and in 2000 she started an used shoes business. She became familiar with Hluvuku through friends who were partners. She wanted to expand her business and requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 meticais. She intends to buy men's, women's and children's shoes in bulk in order to increase her inventory and with that her income, her life and her family's life. Her dream is to finish college and to become a great businesswoman. She intends to request more loans to fulfill her dreams.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of men's, women's and children's shoes in bulk

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De Peligro 6 Group

texts.en:
Susana is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Unidas de Peligro 6 (United Dangerous Women). She began with Kiva partner, Esperanza, because she needed to for her business. She now loves the program and her loan partners. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity. Susana makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and one child.
Susana is excited to be taking her ninth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has run her business for almost seven years, and started out by selling small amounts of fruits from a bag as she walked along the street. She plans to use this loan to invest in her fruit stand by buying papaya, watermelon, mangoes, salad and other items such as cosmetics and clothes. She will use the profits to buy a television and school supplies. Susana wants to improve her business so that she can save to build her house. She says that her most difficult challenge is to build her house. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying being with her family.

loans.use: To buy papaya, avocado, watermelon, cucumber, fabrics and cosmetics

loans.name: Vianora Petino

texts.pt:
VIAINORA C. nasceu na catembe um dos distritos  da capital mocambicana na provincia de Maputo .frequentou o seu ensino primario e secundario no mesmo distrito e passou depois a estudar na cidade de maputo onde fez o ensino pre-universitario.
Estuda e e faz negocio a mais de 5 anos,  onde atraves de vizinhas e amigas ouviu falar da Hluvuku tendo aproximado para solicitar o seu emprestimo. Com o presente credito no valor de 15.000.00mt pretende comprar produtos (arroz,acucar, cervejas,refrescos,feijao,amendoim e outros)para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futro pretende continuar com seus estudos e solicitar mais emprestimos para desenvolver ainda mais o seu nogocio.
texts.en:
Viainora was born in Catembe, one of the districts of the capital of Mozambique, in the province of Maputo. She went to elementary and middle school in the same district. Later she went to the city of Maputo for high school. She goes to school and has had her business for more than 5 years. She became familiar with Hluvuku through neighbors and friends. She came to request her loan. With the current loan in the amount 15,000 meticais she intends to purchase products (rice, sugar, beer, sodas, beans, peanuts and others) to increase her inventory. In the future, she intends to continue her studies and request more loans to expand her business even more.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products (rice, sugar, beer, sodas, beans, peanuts and others)

loans.name: Flor De Mayo 2 Group

texts.es: Doña Santos tiene 45 años D. edad, es casada D. oficios Domésticos, tiene 6 hijos, se dedica a la Tejeduría (Elaboración D. Sabanas y Manteles), cuenta con dos operarios y telares, con 12 años D. experiencia, recibe un crédito por medio del Banco Comunal denominado FLOR D. MAYO 2 el cual en conformado por dieciséis mujeres, cordinado por ella misma, el préstamo recibido lo invertirá como capital D. trabajo adquiriendo  materia prima, para incrementar elñ volumen D. producción y cubrir la demanda D. sus clientes, sueña con ver su negocio mucho más granD. y que les generé mejores ganancias. D. igual manera las integrantes D. este grupo esperan que con la inversión que hacen capitalizando su negocio, hará que tengan mejoresD. ganacias y mejores condiciones D. vida.
texts.en:
Doña Santos is 45 years old and is a married homemaker with 6 children. She is a weaver (Making Sheets and Tablecloths), she has two operators and looms, with 12 years of experience. She is receiving a loan through the Communal Bank called FLOR D. MAYO 2 ("Flower of May 2") which is maD. up of sixteen women, who she coordinates. The loan received will be invested as working capital buying raw materials, to increase the production volume and cover the demand of the customers. She dreams of seeing her business grow much bigger and generate greater profits. Likewise the members of this group hope that with the investment that they make putting capital into their businesses, it will mean that they have better profits and better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Gaby

texts.es: Gaby tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 6 meses ha iniciado un nuevo negocio, que es la venta de comida y lo realiza por las tardes en su misma casa, lugar que habilitó para tener su negocio. Desde entonces, todas las mañanas se encarga de preparar la comida, así como se gana la vida, además cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, ya sea atendiendo a los clientes o preparando la comida. Afirma que éste negocio es rentable, por que le permite tener las ganancias parta volver a invertir y ahorrar para cualquier necesidad que tenga en su hogar.  En adelante desea mejorar su negocio, por lo que espera implementar de más productos y materiales para su establecimiento este mejor que antes. Es su sexto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, utilizará en la compra de nuevas mesas y sillas, también invertirá en la compra de productos para preparar mas comida.
texts.en:
Gaby is 36 years old, lives with her husband and two children in a leased home. Six months ago she started a new business selling food from her home in the afternoons. Since then, every morning she prepares food in order to make a living. She depends on her children for help with serving customers and preparing the food. She says this business is profitable because it allows her to use the profits to reinvest in necessities for her home. In the future she would like to improve her business by adding more products and materials to the establishment. This is her sixth loan with MPF and she is very content knowing that she has the financial support and she has always demonstrated responsibility with her payments. She likes being part of this group as all of the members are very responsible, supportive, and appreciative of the people managing the loans which will be helpful with the progress of her business. With this loan, she will purchase new tables and chairs as well as purchase more products to prepare food.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Sabahi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her business

loans.name: Carla Hermelinda

texts.pt:
Carla hermelinda Z. , nasceu num dos bairros prefericos da cidade capital  Maputo,onde concluiu o seu ensino medio
Com o crescimento do seu agregado familiar teve a necessidade de construir a sua propria casa.  Atravez do seu servico conheceu a hluvuku onde teve financiamento para iniciar a construcao da sua casa.
Com  o presente emprestimo no valor de 20.000.00mt pretende comprar materiais de construcao (cimento,portas ,ferros e tinta) para concluir a sua casa.
A sua vida vai melhorar com emprestimo pelo que vai ter uma casa condigna que lhe vai proporcionar o bem estar com a sua familia.
O seu sonho futuro e de construir um salao de beleza para para aumentar a renda familiar e vai recorrer a mais emprestimos.
texts.en:
Carla Hermelinda was born in the suburbs of the capital, Maputo, where she finished high school. With the growth of her family she felt the need to build her own house. She became familiar with Hluvuku through her job and with Hluvuku she received the loan to start construction. With the current loan, in the amount of 20,000 meticais, she intends to buy construction materials (cement, doors, iron and paint) to finish her house. Her life will be better with the loan since she will have a decent house and provide for her family's well being. Her future is to build a beauty salon to increase her family's income. She plans to request more loans.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, doors, iron and paint)

loans.name: Salome

texts.es: La Sra. Salome vive en la localidad de la Guardia en el Barrio Monte Alto,  tiene domicilio propio, su actividad es el comercio productos medicinales, el destino del crédito fue para comprar mercadería como se manzanilla seca, sangre de grado, romero, etc, estas plantas son muy usadas para tratar distintos malestares ya que es parte de nuestra tradicio andina; La Sra. Salome tiene tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, la Sra. es Madre soltera y esta actividad  es su única fuente de ingreso, para sostener a su familia, hace dos años que  vive en la comunidad,  su vivienda lo  adquirió en base a financiamiento, lo cual tiene que alternar varios negocios que le generen ingresos para poder sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Salome lives in the “La Guardia” area of the Monte Alto neighborhood. She has her own home and sells natural medicinal products. She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise, such as dried chamomile, “dragon’s blood” resin, rosemary, etc. These plants are used to treat different ailments and are a part of our Andean culture. Ms. Salome is a single mother and has three school aged children. This activity is her only source of income with which she supports her family. She’s been living in the neighborhood for two years and acquired her home through financing. She must alternate between various businesses in order to generate the income she needs to move her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. is a hairdresser in Elmina. Aba has no formal education. She is married and takes care of two children. Her husband is a driver. Aba has been a hairdresser for four years. She helps her husband maintain the home. Her loan will be used to acquire more hair creams and hair extensions to meet the demand of her customers. She is confident she will save the new profits from her business to buy an additional dryer.

loans.use: To acquire more hair creams and hair extensions

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana Y. is a widow taking care of seven dependants. Nana smokes fish to sell in Elmina. She has been in this business for 30 years. She has not received any formal education. She is able to manage her home with the income she makes from her sales. Nana will use this loan to purchase more fish to smoke for sale. She plans to reinvest her new profits in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua B. sells gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava), doughnuts, sugar and groundnuts (peanuts) all in small quantities at Elmina. She has received junior high education and is a widow with four children.

Ekua has been in this trade for twenty years. She is responsible for taking care of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more of the ingredients used in preparing doughnuts so that she can sell also in larger quantities. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more of the ingredients used in preparing doughnuts

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua Y. is married to a carpenter and has three children. She has received senior high education.

Ekua sells a variety of fruit such as oranges, melons, bananas and other fruits at Elmina and uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more fruit to sell.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Juana Bautista

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana Bautista M. tiene 53 años D. edad, es separada, tiene 3 hijos , una hija D. 33 años que vive con la misma , otra D. 30 años que vive en España donD. ya formo su familia y un varón D. 30 años que vive con también con la solicitante.
La misma se dedica a la compra  y venta D. chatarras, hierros, cobre y bronce D. talleres, desarmaderos y D. particulares en distintas ciudades del interior del país  para la venta a las empresas recicladoras.
Para ello cuenta con un Camión Mitsubishi Canter  Año 1990 que es manejado por su hijo menor.
El crédito fue destinado a la compra en cantidades grandes  D. chatarras, hierros, cobre y bronce D. talleres, desarmaderos y D. personas particulares para volver a venderlo a las recicladoras y a fabricas D. acumuladores.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Bautista M. is 53 years old. She is separated and has 3 children. One daughter, who is 33 years old, lives with Sra. Juana. Another, who is 30 years old, lives in Spain, where she has her own family. And her son, who is also 30 years old, lives with her as well. Sra. Juana makes her living buying scrap metal, iron, copper and bronze from workshops, chop shops and individuals in different cities of the interior of the country. She then sells them to recycling companies. To accomplish this work, she has a 1990 Mitsubishi Canter, which her younger son drives. The loan was used to purchase large quantities of scrap iron, iron, copper and bronze from workshops, chop shops and individuals to then sell to recycling and storage facilities.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to purchase scrap metal, iron, copper and bronze.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama M. M. is married and operates a food business where she prepares banku (a local dish made from corn dough and served hot with soup) and fufu (starchy dumplings made from cassava, yam, plantain or rice that is eaten with soup or stew) for sale at Elmina. Her husband is an electrician and together they take care of their five dependents.

Ama’s loan is going to enable her bring more variety into the type of food she prepares. She will use the loan to buy foodstuffs and some new ingredients to prepare the kind of food her new costumers are demanding.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to plough the money back into her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and new ingredients

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana A. is married and has six dependents. She has no educational background.

Nana sells cassava and plantain at Elmina and has been in this business for thirty years. She uses the revenue she is able to gather from her sales to support her husband in taking care of her dependents.

Nana will use the loan to purchase more cassava and plantain to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to provide a meaningful education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava and plantain to sell

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en:
Adjowa B. sells rice, vegetables, palm oil and other foodstuffs at Elmina. She has received junior high education. She is married to a mason and has three children.

Adjowa has been selling rice and other foodstuffs for seven years, supporting her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to sell.

Adjowa hopes to use the new earnings from her business to save to build a better shop for her goods.

loans.use: To buy more of foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Perla Elodia

texts.es:
La señora Perla S., es  de profesión modista, vive en casa propia , junto con su esposo y su hijo quien está estudiando, su esposo trabaja como sereno en la Facultad de odontología, y apoya bastante en los trabajos que realiza su esposa.
La misma es modista de profesión, pero en particular le gusta confeccionar carteras para damas, en distintos  modelos y colores, trabaja en especial con los comercios que están situados en el microcentro.
El Crédito para ella es muy importante por eso lo cuida como a una de sus máquinas porque es una herramienta que le permite progresar.
Cuenta que de a poco y con mucho sacrificio fue juntado dinero para comprarse su primera  máquina que entre risas dice tenerla todavía, pero accediendo a los créditos fue adquiriendo  otras.
texts.en:
Ms. Perla S. is a seamstress. She lives with her husband and their son, who is a student, in a house they own. Her husband is a night watchman at the Faculty of Odontology, and he is quite supportive of his wife’s work. A seamstress by profession, she particularly likes creating wallets for women, in different models and colors; she works especially for the shops located in the small city center. The loan is very important for her and this is why she tends to it like it was one of her machines, because she considers it a tool enabling her to progress. She said that little by little and with much effort she succeeded in saving money to buy her first sewing machine, that she still happily owns, and she has been buying a few more thanks to the loans she has been granted.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy core materials such as artificial leather, threads, clasps, accessories

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: La Sra. Yolanda Vive en la localidad de la guardia distante a 20 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, en el Barrio Monte Alto, su actividad es la venta de empanadas,  chicha bebida típica de santa cruz, pollos fritos; su esposo se dedica a la construcción, el cual conjuntamente con su esposa sustentan a su familia, sus hijos se encuentran en  edad escolar, el destino del crédito es para construir un techo en su domicilio  para guardar su vehículo que le sirve como medio de transporte  para su negocio; y necesita comprar material de construccion como teja, cemento, etc. hace 8 año que vive en la zona y es el mismo tiempo que se dedica al mismo negocio, es muy trabajadora y muy responsable siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Yolanda lives in the Monte Alto neighborhood of La Guardia, located 20 km away from the town of Santa Cruz. Her activity is to sell empanadas (stuffed bread), the typical Santa Cruz chicha (chicha being a variety of maize-derived fermented beverage, common all over South America), and fried chickens. Her husband works in constructions, and provides for the family together with his wife. Their children are attending school. The loan she is requesting will be used to build a canopy in her house that will shelter the vehicle she uses as transportation mean for her activity. She needs to buy construction materials such as tiles, concrete and so on. She has been living in the area for 8 years and has been engaging in her activity for about the same amount of time. She is a very hard-working and responsible person, always preoccupied with the well-being of her family. She is really thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is married and takes care of five dependants. She has not received any formal education. She smokes fish to sell in Elmina. She has been doing this for ten years. Her husband works as a security man. Rose uses her income to help her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. Rose will use this loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. Rose plans to  reinvest the new profits from her extended business back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to smoke

loans.name: Sandra Mirtha

texts.es: La Sra. Sandra vive en la localidad de el torno distante a 39 km de la ciudad de santa cruz, en  el Barrio Miraflores, su actividad principal es la venta de frutas, y peinadora, su esposo por la falta de trabajo viajo al exterior en busca de un futuro prometedor, y así ayudar a su esposa a sacar adelante  a su familia, ya que son cuatros sus hijo en edad escolar, hace 6 años que vive en la comunidad, a base de créditos financieros a podido construir su casa y tener un capital necesario para trabajar, con el dinero del crédito comprara frutas de temporada como se chirimoya, mandarina, papaya, etc. Es muy trabajadora y muy responsable siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Sandra lives the Miraflores neighborhood of the El Torno, located 39 km away from the town of Santa Cruz. Her main activity is to sell fruits, on top of being a hairdresser. Due to the lack of jobs, her husband has traveled abroad looking for a more promising future that will allow him to help his wife providing for their family, composed of 6 children of school age. She has been living in the community for 6 years, and thanks to some loans she has been able to build her house and succeeded in having enough money to maintain her activity. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy seasonal fruits such as cherimoyas (custard apples), tangerines, papayas and so on. She is a very hard-working and responsible woman, always caring for the well-being of her family. She is really thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
