Ekua J. sells various sizes of polythene bags at Elmina. She has received senior high education. She is divorced and takes care of three children.

Ekua has been selling polythene bags for fifteen years and is able to feed and educate her children with the little income she makes from her sales. Her loan will be used to buy more bales of polythene bags to distribute to her customers.

Ekua plans to open a shop for her business as a result of the profit she hopes to earn.

loans.use: To buy more bales of polythene bags to sell

loans.name: Melania

texts.es:
Melania Catalina R.  es una señora de 63 años de edad, viuda,  la cual vive con sus 2 hijos  en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Desde hace 2 años  doña Melania inició un negocio venta de ropa. Ella tiene un local cerca de casa, ahí tiene su propia tienda de ropa la cual ha podido sacar adelante poco a poco. Sin embargo ella asegura que por falta de financiamiento se ha quedado un poco estancada. 

Es por eso que Doña Melania  necesita un préstamo de ¢300.000 (trescientos     mil colones). Para comprar más ropa y mejorar las condiciones del local. Con esto ella logrará que su local se vea mejor y pueda ofrecerles más opciones a sus clientes que dicen estar muy contentos con la nueva tiendita 

Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo,  y con él espera crecer seguir creciendo como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Melania Catalina R. is a 63 year-old widow, who lives with her 2 children in a community called Santa Fe, which is located in Los Chiles in the Alajuela province. This community is in a mountainous region very close to the northern border of the country. The main economic activities there are livestock and agriculture, particularly the cultivation of staple grains, sugar cane and oranges. Two years ago, Melania started a business selling clothing. She has a place close to her house where she has her own clothing store, which she has gradually developed over time. However, she tells us that the lack of financing has been an obstacle to growth. For this reason, Melania needs a loan of 300,000 Costa Rican colones, to buy more clothing and improve the condition of her shop. With this loan, she will make her store look better and be able to offer more options to her customers, who say that they are very satisfied with the new store. She is a member of the communal bank "Manantial de Santa Fe," one of the 100 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and with it she hopes to continue growing as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: clothing sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Estrellita Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se a formado gracias a la señora Apolonia S. quien invito a sus amigas y de esa forma formaron su comité y se encuentran trabajando cada una en sus actividades.

Una de las integrantes es la señora Elizabeth quien se dedica  a la peluqueria, realiza trabajos como cortes, peinados, tintes, ademas compra cabellos para realizar alargues, todo el trabajo lo realiza en su local propio que posee en su casa.

Ella solicita el prestamo para la compra de cabellos.

Estas mujeres son muy responsables y trabajadoras y necesitan de mucha ayuda para salir adelante de la mejor manera posible.
texts.en:
This group was formed thanks to the Señora Apolonia S., of the Pueblo neighborhood. Apolonia has a beauty salon, and also buys and sells hair. She was very interested in the Fundación, and the loans it makes. She holds her group meetings in her house, and together all members of the group work and make efforts to make economic progress, both for the group as a whole and for their families. She is requesting a loan to buy more hair. These women are very responsible and hardworking, and are motivated to continue ahead with their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hair

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase stone, sand, and cement to build a room for his daughter

loans.name: Oldemar

texts.es:
Oldemar H. Briseño   es un señor de 37    años de edad el  cual vive con su esposa y dos hijos   en una comunidad llamada Coquital  localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos y  naranja. 

Don Oldemar  y su familia siempre se han  dedicado a la ganadería de doble propósito aprovechando tanto la carne como la producción de leche.  Comenta que es muy buen negocio ya que la demanda es bastante grande alta en la comunidad, y hoy  sus productos se venden a buen precio en especial la Leche.

Actualmente don Oldemar    desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢618.000 (seiscientos dieciocho    mil colones), para comprar  2  vacas que ya conocen muy bien, ellas están aumentadas por lo que podrá sacar provecho para vender su leche a buen precio.

El forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Rapicrédito Progreso Futuro Coquital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su  primer crédito  y con  espera  mejorar su negocio cada día.
texts.en:
Oldemar H. Briseño is a 37 year-old man who lives with his wife and 2 children in a community called Coquital, which is located in Los Chiles in the Alajuela province. This community is in a mountainous area very close to the northern border of the country. The main economic activities here are livestock and agriculture, particularly the cultivation of staple grains and oranges. Oldemar and his family have always worked in livestock production, with the dual objective of producing meat and milk. He comments that it is a very good business, since the demand is sufficiently high in his community, and today his products sell at a good price, particularly the milk. Now Oldemar wants to take out a micro-loan of 618,000 Costa Rican colones, to buy 2 cows that he knows well. These cows are pregnant, and this will allow him to profit by selling their milk at a good price. Oldemar is part of the communal bank "Rapicrédito Progreso Futuro Coquital," one of the 100 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan, and with it he hopes to improve his business every day.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase sand, cement, and stone to build a porch for her house

loans.name: Rosa Amanda

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Amanda de 36 años de edad es casada con el Sr. Angel G. Mendez, habitan junto a sus hijas en el municipio del Almendro en la comarca Villa Alvarez, donde tiene una una finca de 113 mzs, Su finca presenta buenas condiciones de pastos natural, pasto mejorado y aguaje de todo tiempo, le brinda buen manejo a su invenario, ademas obtiene ingresos adicionales por la venta de leche, la cual la vende a la lechera El Triunfo. 

Esta solicitando refinanciamiento de su 6to credito para comprar  12 ternero desarrollo de un kilo de 245, y engordarlos para posteriormente comercializarlo con personas que llegan de villa Alvarez.  Rosa Amanda se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, dirige su actividad principal con sus hijas y esposo, esta agradecida con el apoyo financiero que ha recibido de la institución de AFODENIC, ya que gracias a las ganancias obtenidas por los creditos financiados ha ido comprado poco a poco su finca, pues ha administrado correctamente los recursos económicos que tiene.   Rosa Amanda se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente clienta, cumplida con su deberes crediticio, responsable.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Amanda is 36 years old and married to Sr. Angel G. Mendez. They live together with their daughters in the town of Almendro in the region of Villa Alvarez. There they have a farm that measures 113 “manzanas” (approximately 195.5 acres). Her farm is well conditioned with natural grasslands, improved pastures, and a constant source of water as a result of good management. In addition, Rosa earns additional income by selling milk to the El Triunfo dairy company.

She is requesting her sixth loan to buy twelve calves to raise for fattening and resale to people who come to Villa Alvarez. Rosa Amanda is known as a hardworking woman who operates her business with her daughters and husband. She appreciates the support she has received from AFODENIC because she has gradually been able to expand her farm by correctly managing her available financial resources. Rosa Amanda is an excellent client since she completes her loan obligations in a responsible manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase twelve calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase materials needed to replace the roof of her house

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel de 27 años de edad  es casado, labora en la alcaldía municipal de Nueva Guinea como supervisor de proyecto,  ademas cuenta con ingresos adicionales que le permiten mayor estabilidad economica. 

Abel esta solicitando su 2do credito  para realizar compra de material de construcción y poder construir un dormitorio que le brindara mayor comodidad a su familia. Expresa sentirse muy satisfecho con el servicio recibido, pues con el credito anterior logro comprar su computadora, la que le sirve como instrumento de trabajo en su jornada diaria. 

Se ha caracterizado por ser un excelente cliente, responsable, honesto, de buen liderazgo, su familia es de buenos principios religiosos y morales.
texts.en:
Abel is 27 years old, married, and works for the City of Nueva Guinea as a project supervisor. He also has additional income that allows him to have greater financial stability.

Abel is requesting his second loan so that he can buy construction materials to build a bedroom that will provide greater comfort for his family. He is very happy with the service he has received. With his previous loan he was able to purchase a computer that he uses every day for work.

Abel is known for being an excellent client. He is responsible, honest, demonstrates good leadership, and comes from a family with outstanding religious principles and morals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build an additional bedroom

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa de 51 años de edad es casada con el Sr. Benicio Gonzalez, habita junto a su familia en la zona # 2 de Nueva Guinea, se desempeña como comerciante, pues tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa de habitacion donde vende diferentes productos de uso personal, como ropa, calzado, cosmeticos.  

Esta solicitando 2do crédito con el objetivo de enverjar su casa y de esta forma contar con mayor seguridad en su  propiedad  y ademas garantizar la seguridad de su negocio. Maria Luisa se caracteriza por ser una señora  trabajadora, responsable, cumplida con su compromisos créditicios.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Luisa is 51 years old and married to Sr. Benicio Gonzalez. They live together with their family in District #2 of Nueva Guinea, where she works as a merchant. She has a small store in her home where she sells different products for personal use such as clothing, shoes, and cosmetics.

She is requesting her second loan so that she can install security bars around her house so that her property will be more secure and she can guarantee the safety of her business. Maria Luisa is known for being a hardworking and responsible woman who has fulfilled her loan commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install security bars around her house

loans.name: San Crispin Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “SAN CRISPIN” (el santo de los zapateros), esta solicitando  crédito por primera vez, es parte del Centro Focal de German Busch.

Compuesta por nueve personas, un varón y ocho socias mujeres, se particulariza por que las y el socio, tienen negocios relacionados a la elaboración y venta de calzados.  Más del 50% producen zapatos para “cholita”, zapatos de suela que son ajustados en la planta con estaquillas (clavos de madera) y el resto produce zapatos normales.

La señora Sonía Q., presidenta de la asociación, tiene un negocio de zapatería.  Hace siete años que aprendió de este negocio a través de la cuñada.  Este primer crédito de Bs. 2000.-  le da la oportunidad de comprar material para elaborar zapatos. Actualmente comparte con el esposo este trabajo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank St. Crispin (patron saint of shoemakers), part of the regional hub of Germain Busch, is requesting a loan for the first time. With nine members, one male and eight female, its particularity is that all of them own business related to shoe-making and shoe-selling. Over 50% of the members make"cholita" shoes, which are soled and built using wooden studs, and the rest produce ordinary shoes. Sonia Q., president of the association, owns a shoe-making business. Seven years ago he learned the ropes of the business through her sister-in-law. This first loan of Bs 2000 will give her the opportunity to buy materials to make shoes. She currently shares the work with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Soles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase materials to build an extension to his house

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es: Alexis M. J. , tiene la edad de 39 años, está en unión libre, y  tiene 2  hijos, uno de 12 y otro de 7 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado para revenderlos y transportarlos a diferentes lugares o fincas  y así ganarse el flete. Con esto el espera  obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Alexis  tiene algunos años dedicada al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Alexis M. J. is 39 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children (ages 12 and 7). This loan will be used to buy livestock for resale. He transports them to different places and farms that want to build up a herd. Alexis hopes to earn the highest income possible when selling the animals. He also wants to increase the number of animals he has and be able to raise them in the best conditions. Alexis has an ideal area that is suitable for maintaining them.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the services that have been provided. Don Alexis has several years of experience raising livestock. He hopes in the future to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater financial stability. In addition, he hopes to continue growing as a person and as producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock for resale

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.es: Marjorie González R., tiene la edad de 32 años, está casada, y vive con el esposo  y dos hijos de 11 y 5 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de mercadería para abastecer su tienda. Desea tener un inventario más variado de prendas de vestir, para ampliar su negocio. Hace algunos años que empezó este negocio viendo la necesidad de aportar a la economía de su hogar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como comerciante.
texts.en:
Marjorie González R. is 32 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children, ages 11 and 5. This loan will be used to purchase merchandise so that she can restock her store. She wants to have an inventory that contains a wide variety of clothing so that she can expand her business. Marjorie started her business several years ago because she needed a way to provide financial support for her household.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDEOCUSR and she is very happy with the services that have been provided. She hopes in the future to provide her family with a better quality of life and greater financial stability. In addition, Marjorie wants to continue growing as a person and as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her retail store

loans.name: Neysi Nadin

texts.es:
Neysi de 26 años de edad es madre soltera de una niña, actualmente se desempeña como pequeña comerciante de productos lacteos en Nueva Guinea. Cuenta con la ayuda economica del padre de su hija quien le pasa una pension que le permite solventar los gastos del hogar.  

Esta solicitando refinanciamiento de su 6to credito para invertirlo en la compra de compra productos lácteos para posteriormente venderlos en todas la colonias de Nueva Guinea y finaliza la comercialización entregando en Managua.  

Su mayor sueño es tener su propia empresa y tener su propio capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Neysi, age 26, is a single mother of one daughter. She currently works as a small merchant selling dairy products in Nueva Guinea. Her partner helps her financially; he receives benefit payments that allow him to cover household expenses. Neysi is applying for her 6th loan to invest in the purchase of dairy products to sell in the neighborhoods of Nueva Guinea, finishing her sales in the capital city of Managua. Her greatest dream is to have her own business and working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María del Carmen es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector Las Flores de la Pradera, una zona urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, se encuentra ubicada a quince minutos del centro de la ciudad.

Ella es profesora y actualmente se vale de esta profesión para ganarse la vida y ayudar a sus vecinos. Ella ha fundado desde hace tres años una institución educativa que funciona en su vivienda, allí ella brinda educación inicial a los diversos niños de la zona cobrándo precios cómodos, algunos estudiantes del lugar le apoyan dando clases y juntos pueden sacar adelante esta pequeña escuela.

María divide su tiempo entre el cuidado de sus alumnos y en el de su familia, su esposo es maestro constructor y con el dinero que ambos ganan sacan adelante a su hogar. 

María desea realizar mejoras en el baño del colegio para que sus alumnos puedan estudiar con mayor comodidad, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles que le permitan comprar el material para realizar esta acción.

María es una mujer bastante conocida y estimada en la zona por su labor y entrega a su profesion, su mayor anhelo es poder encontrar un terreno propio para que su Institución Educativa tenga un local mas apropiado.
texts.en:
María del Carmen, 39, is a mother living with her husband and children in Las Flores de la Pradera, an urban zone on the outskirts of the city of Chiclayo located fifteen minutes from city center. She is a teacher and uses her profession to support herself and help her neighbors. Three years ago she established an educational institution in her home. She provides initial education to neighborhood children charging affordable rates. Some of the local students help her teach some of the classes and their joint effort has enabled the small school to succeed. María divides her time between caring for her students and caring for her family. Her husband is a master builder and their combined income allows them to support their household. María would like to make some improvements to the school’s bathroom so that her students will be more comfortable. Thus she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 800 new sol, loan to buy the materials and supplies needed for this project. María is quite well known and liked in her community because of her work and her dedication to her profession. Her greatest wish is to come by a piece of property on which to install her educational institution more appropriately.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies to repair bathroom in educational institution located in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: trousers, blouses and sandals

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es: El Sr. Modesto vive en el Porvenir una comunidad a 25 Km de Santa Rita, el es primera ves que trabaja con Emprender por que se hizo una visita a esa comunidad en el cual el quedo convencido por las facilidades del credito y la rapidez de los tramites, Hace 12 años que compro una parcela que ahora la trabaja es el soltero y Nacio en Chuquisaca tiene 47 años, su hermano vive en la misma comunidad y juntos siembran (maiz, arroz). Ellos también se dedican a la carboneria y a la crianza de animales, con el dinero del credito compraran semillas para la siembra de maiz, el Sr. Modesto es muy trabajador y esta agradecido por la oportunidad que se le brinda.
texts.en:
Mr. Modesto lives in Porvenir, a community that is located 25 kilometers from Santa Rita. This is the first time that he has worked with field partner Emprender. After a visit by Emprender to his community he was convinced by the ease of the loan and the speed of the paperwork. It has been 12 years since he purchased the parcel that he now works on. Mr. Modesto was born in Chuquisaca, he is single and is 47 years old. His brother lives in the same community and together they plant corn and rice. They also dedicate themselves to coal mining and raising animals. With this loan he will purchase seeds to plant corn. Mr. Modesto is very hardworking and is grateful for the opportunity granted to him.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds to plant corn

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es: Marco Tulio A. B., tiene la edad de 59 años, está casado, y  tiene un hijo de  9 años de edad, que es su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Marco Tulio también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Marco Tulio A. B. is 59 years old and married. He has a 9 year old son that is his highest priority. He will use the loan to buy manure and fertilizer to help with his coffee farming. He wants to provide the best growing conditions possible in order to produce a high quality coffee crop and earn the best price possible at harvest time. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the facilities that they offer him. Don Marco Tulio has worked in agriculture for several years. He hopes that in the future he can give his family a better quality of life and more economic stability and, to be able to keep growing as a person and a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase manure and fertilizer for his coffee farm

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marco Antonio A. M., tiene la edad de 22 años, está casado, y aún no tiene hijos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de máquinas especiales para trabajos en madera. Desea comprar máquinas y herramientas para trabajar en madera. Cuenta con experiencia en el trabajo, sabe utilizar adecuadamente las herramientas y la maquinaria. El desea ser más eficiente en su trabajo, cuenta con muy buenos clientes, por eso ve la necesidad de actualizar su equipo de trabajo para desempeñarse de la mejor manera con su trabajo, además de aportar mayores ingresos para la economía de su hogar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecido con las facilidades que se le brindaron. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como trabajador.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio A. M. is 22 years old and married. He does not have any children yet. With this loan he wants to buy special machines and tools for wood working. He has experience in this line of work and he knows how to use these machines and tools. He has very good customers and he wants to be more efficient in his work. For this reason he sees the need to modernize his equipment so that he can do the best job possible and earn a better income for his household. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very grateful for the services that they offer him. He hopes that in the future he can give his family a better quality of life and more economic stability and, to be able to continue growing as a person and a worker.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase machines and tools for wood working

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sand, cement and flooring

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús tiene 30 años, vive con su esposa y su hijo en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 4 años trabaja fabricando ladrillos, es un trabajador dependiente en una empresa, asimismo comprar al por mayor ladrillos para luego venderlos a un precio más elevado a otras ciudades.  De esta manera es que puede dar seguridad económica a su familia, por otro lado su esposa lo apoya en la economía, elaborando bordados de trajes típicos de su zona. Afirma que su trabajo aunque es muy sacrificado tiene sus recompensas por que le permite tener buenas rentas para su economía, además que su trabajo es estable durante todo el año. Jesús quiere para el futuro tener su propia fábrica de ladrillos para poder disponer libremente de su tiempo. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará ladrillos al por mayor y una parte en la compra de materiales que utilizará su esposa en los bordados.
texts.en:
Jesús is 30 years old. He lives with his wife and son in a rented house. He has been making bricks for 4 years. He is a reliable worker in a business, and he also buys bricks wholesale to later sell them at a higher price in other cities. In this way, he can give his family financial security. On the other hand, his wife supports him with the finances embroidering traditional clothing from the area. He states that although his job is very demanding, it has its rewards becasue it allows him to have good earnings. In addition, his work is stable all year. For the future, Jesús wants to have his own brick factory to be able to manage his own time. This is his seventh loan with MFP. He is very happy to know that he has this financial support. He has shown himself to be very responsible with his payments. He also likes being part of his community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. He thanks those people who will participate in the loan he is asking for and it will be very useful for his business' progress. With the loan that he is asking for, he will buy bricks wholesale and will use a prt to buy the materials his wife uses in her embroidery.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bricks wholesale

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca de 31 años, vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil), ella tiene una tienda de víveres en donde vende legumbres, enlatados, canes etc. 

Ella tiene la tienda desde que se separo de su esposo para poder conseguir sus propios ingresos, comenzó comprando verduras y vegetales. Desde ese tiempo ella a continuado trabajando para mantener a sus dos hijos de 4 y 10 años, vendiendo toda clase de víveres. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. 

Para poder incrementar su mercadería ella quiere comprar con el préstamo bebidas, lácteos, verduras. En el futuro quiere ampliar y surtir mas su tienda para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rebeca, 31, lives in Primavera de Durán (an ecologically eroding periurban area on the outskirts of Guayaquil). She has a grocery store where she sells vegetables, canned goods, meats, etc. She has had the store since she separated from her husband in order to earn her own income. She started out buying vegetables. She has worked for a long time now to support her two children, who are 4 and 10 years of age, selling all sorts of foodstuffs. She is open for business from 6am until 10pm every day. She wants funding to increase her available stock buying beverages, dairy products and vegetables. In the future, she’d like to stock her store with still more variety of goods in order to provide a better future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For beverages, dairy products, vegetables.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es: Rosa María V. A., tiene la edad de 64 años, está viuda, y tiene un hijo. El tiene 24 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra pollos para granja y compra de cerdos, la idea es criar los pollos y a los cerdos para luego venderlos, y así obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Rosa desea que este negocio le ayude a dar un aporte económico a su casa. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.
texts.en:
Rosa María V. A. is a 64 year-old widow and has one son. He is 24 years old. She would like this loan in order to buy chickens for her farm, as well as pigs. The idea is to raise the chickens and pigs and then sell them, and in this manner to get the best possible prices when she sells them. This is the first time that she is taking out a loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the service offered to her. Ms. Rosa hopes that this business will help her to provide economic support to her household. In the future, she hopes to offer her family a better quality of life and greater economic stability. She also hopes to be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs

loans.name: Alexander Jose

texts.es: Alexander José tiene 24 años, su actividad económica es realizar la venta de lotería. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues está pensando en mejor su negocio, por lo que él es un hombre muy luchador y que disfruta de su actividad, por lo que recorre distancias muy largas para ofrecer sus productos de lotería nacional y premios instantáneos, por lo que se cansa mucho pero vale la pena para mantener a su familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima e invertir en su negocio. el sueña con seguir trabajando y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Alexander José is 24 years and he sells lottery tickets. He has dedicated himself to this business for 18 years. He is a hardworking man that enjoys his business which is why he travels long distances to offer his lottery products and instant prizes. He gets tired a lot but it is worth it to support his family. The loan he is requesting is to purchase materials and to invest in his business. He dreams of continuing to work and improving his standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mariana Lucrecia

texts.es:
Mariana de 35 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas), ella elabora y vende peluches de felpa. 

Empezó trabajando en un taller de confecciones de peluches, cuando aprendió hacer al por mayor lo peluches decidió independizarse y ganar su propio dinero, poco a poco con esfuerzo y la ayuda de su pareja pudo tener su propio negocio, ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 16h00pm todos los días. 

Para tener una mayor producción de peluches ella quiere comprar con el préstamo tela, lana, algodón. En el futuro quiere tener un taller de confección con empleados que le ayuden.
texts.en:
Mariana, 35, lives in Guayaquil’s Las Orquídeas (orchids) neighborhood (an urban zone so-called because when it was discovered there were a lot of orchids there). She makes stuffed toys out of felt to sell. She started out as an employee in a stuffed toy workshop. When she learned how to make the items in quantity she decided to become independent and earn her own money. Gradually, with effort and help from her life partner, she was able to get her own business. Now, she works from 8am until 4pm every day. In order to increase production, she needs funds to buy wool and cotton fabric. In the future, she’d like to have a manufacturing workshop with employees to help her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool and cotton fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials: stone, cement, sand, concrete blocks

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus 7 hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 25 años de trayectoria desarrollando las diversas actividades del campo, paralelo a ello tiene una tienda. Generalmente ella y su familia se dedican más a la agricultura, en donde  siembran papa y maíz, ya que tienen disponible estos productos para el consumo diario, asimismo cría animales entre ellos: vacas y ovejas. Es de esta manera como distribuye su tiempo para tener satisfacción en su trabajo, siempre recibiendo el apoyo de sus hijos y de su esposo. Para el futuro desea incrementar sus cultivos con más extensiones de terreno y tener una tienda mas surtida. Es su catorceavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, utilizará en la compra de una vaca de raza criolla y también en la compra de más productos para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Julia is 48 years old and lives with her husband and their 7 children in a house they own. She has 25 years of experience in the diverse activities of a farm, and at the same time, she runs a store. Generally, she and her family work more in agriculture. They plant potatoes and corn so that they always have these available for daily consumption. They also raise animals together: cows and sheep. This is how she distributes her time, in order to find satisfaction in her work. She is always receiving help from her children and husband. In the future, she would like to increase her crops by planting on more land, and also to have a better-stocked store. This is her fourteenth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is very pleased to know that she has financial support, and she has always shown herself to be responsible with her repayments. She is also grateful to be part of a communal bank because all of her fellow members are responsible people who are dedicated to the group. She is grateful to those people who will be managing the loan she is requesting, as it will be very useful in the progress of her business. She will use the requested loan to buy a cow of the criollo breed, and also to buy more products to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store, and also to buy a cow

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es: Ángela del Carmen tiene 2 hijos menores de edad, por lo que siempre esa pendiente de lo que necesitan. Ella necesita sufragar los gastos del hogar, por lo que no es la primera vez que recurre a los financiamientos, ya que ha sido de gran beneficio para su negocio. Ella se dedica a vender productos como perfumes, calzado, ropa, toallas y sabanas pues todos los días se levanta para vender sus productos, día a día trabaja arduamente en llevar el pan de cada día. Este financiamiento es para comprar materia prima. En un futuro le gustaría establecer una pulpería en su vivienda, pero hasta los momentos quisiera tener un gran inventario.
texts.en:
Ángela Del Carmen has two young children and is always aware of their needs. She must also defray the household expenses. This is not the first time she has obtained a loan, which has been a great benefit for her business. She sells products such as perfumes, shoes, clothing, towels and sheets. She sells her products every day and works arduously day after day to provide for her family. This loan will be used to purchase raw materials. In the future she would like to establish a grocery store in her home but for the moment she would like to have a large inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, butter, and firewood

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente es un padre de familia de 41 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de Pacanga, un distrito que pertenece a la provincia de Chepén en la región La Libertad, la zona se encuentra ubicada aproximadamente a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace doce años a labores asociadas al reciclaje de plástico, el compra botellas de plástico a los recicladores de la zona para luego trasladarlo hacia un local de la ciudad de Pacasmayo en donde muele los envases de este material para venderlos en polvo a la ciudad de Lima, donde vuelven a ser utilizados. Vicente se vale de esta actividad para percibir ingresos económicos que le permitan mantener la economía de su familia.

Vicente desea realizar algunas mejoras en la infraestructura de su vivienda de modo que la calidad de vida de su familia mejore, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles. El es una persona bastante trabajadora y responsable, sus vecinos y conocidos le estiman mucho por su modo honrado de trabajo y por que siempre se esfuerza para darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Vicente, 41, is a father living with his wife and children in Pacanga district, Chepén province, La Libertad region, located about an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. For the last twelve years he has been a plastics recycler. He buys plastic bottles from local recyclers and then takes them to the city of Pacasmayo where they are ground up into powder that he then sells in the city of Lima to be reused. This activity generates income with which Vicente is able to support his family. Vicente would like to make some home improvements so that his family’s quality of life will improve. To reach this goal, he has called upon Edpyme Alternativa asking for a 2000 new sol loan. He is quite a hard working person and his neighbors and acquaintances hold him in high esteem thanks to his honest way of working and because he always strives to provide his family with the best.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Wendy Corina

texts.es:
Wendy de 27 años, vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), ella tiene una tienda de víveres para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares. 

Ella comenzó a comprar víveres para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos y también pasar mas tiempo con su hija, compro bebidas, granos, aceites etc. Ahora desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días.   

Para poder incrementar su negocio ella quiere comprar mas víveres como granos, aceites, carnes. En el futuro quiere poder agrandar mas la tienda para tener mas estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Wendy is 27 years old and lives in the suburb of Guayaquil (an urban zone where the majority of the population consists of informal traders). She runs a grocery store to help with the family expenses. She started buying groceries to help her husband with the expenses and also to spend more time with her daughter. She bought drinks, grains, oils, etc. Since then she works from 6:30 am until 9:00 pm every day. In order to increase her business she wants to buy more groceries such as grains, oils and meats. In the future she hopes to expand her store in order to have more economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, canned goods and other inventory for her grocery store.

loans.name: Francisco De Jesús

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco De Jesús M. C.. Es un pequeño agricultor dedicado a labores agrícolas en la siembra de maíz, trigo y frijoles, los créditos solicitados han sido para gastos agrícolas y pago de mano de obra este crédito y los  anteriores los ha pagado de los ingresos de una pulpería y remesa del extranjero.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco De Jesús M. C. is a small farmer engaging in agriculture sowing maize, wheat and beans.The previous loans he has been granted have been used to pay for farming expenses and the salary or his workers; he has repayed the previous loans, and will be repaying the new one he is requesting, with the incomes of a corner shop and from a remittance from abroad.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To prepare his lands, to buy supplies (urea, insecticides) and to pay his workers.

loans.name: Isla Grande Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Isla Grande” es conformado por 18 socios, pertenecientes a la comuna de Castro, al sur de Chile. Sus principales negocios son de mueblería, preparación de milcao (tortilla de papa y chicharrón), minimarket, artesanía en madera, venta de ropa usada y comida rápida.
Marcia es la tesorera de este grupo, en la foto se encuentra en 2º fila, en  1º lugar de izquierda a derecha y viste suéter rojo y chaqueta negra sin mangas.
Ella hace berlines de crema pastelera y de manjar, los cuales aprendió a hacer mediante recetas. Los vende solo los días domingo durante los partidos de fútbol de su comuna. Marcia invertirá este préstamo en materiales para los berlines: harina, azúcar, manjar,  crema y aceite.
Su sueño es tener un negocio idealmente en su casa y vender diferentes tipos de dulces de repostería. Su motivación son sus 4 hijos, de 18, 15, 12 y 6 años. Quiere ahorrar para poder pagarles estudios superiores. 
A Marcia le han  servido mucho los talleres de Fondo Esperanza con respecto a relaciones sociales y comerciales, ya que de esta manera ha podido ampliar sus contactos, lo cual le sido muy útil para el negocio.
Castro es capital de la isla de Chiloé (la isla más grande de América del Sur), en la región de Los L., zona sur austral de Chile. Su paisaje natural se conserva casi en su totalidad sin intervención del hombre. Además posee una cultura de gran riqueza mítica y costumbrista. Uno de sus grandes atractivos son sus Palafitos, edificaciones (casas) construidas sobre pilotes de madera en la ribera, sobre el mar, siendo estos muy famosos en gran parte del mundo.
texts.en:
The “Isla Grande” (Large Island) communal bank has 18 members from Castro commune in south Chile. Its main businesses are: furniture making, milcao (potato and fried pork skin torte) making, minimarkets, wood handicrafts, used clothing sales and fast-food preparation. Marcia is group treasurer. In the photo, she’s the first person in the second row, wearing a red sweater and black, sleeveless jacket. She makes cream puffs that she learned how to make following recipes. She sells them on Sundays during her commune’s football games. She will use the funds to buy ingredients to make the cream puffs: flour, sugar, pastry cream, cream and cooking oil. Her dream is to have a store, ideally in her home, to sell various kinds of sweets and pastries. She is motivated by her four children who are 18, 15, 12 and 6 years of age. She wants to save up in order to afford their higher education. Fondo Esperanza’s courses have been very helpful to Marcia with respect to social and commercial relations. Through them, she has managed to increase her contacts which have been very useful for the business. Castro is the capital of Chiloé Island (South America’s largest island). It’s in the Los L. region in the south of Chile. Its natural habitat is almost untouched by man. In addition it is rich in culture and traditions. One of its main attractions is the Palafitos (homes, constructed on wooden stilts along the shore over the water; they are world famous.)

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients to make cream puffs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Luchadores Por La Vida Group

texts.en:
The communal bank “Luchadores por la Vida” is composed of 21 members from the city of Talca. They are involved in artisan crafts, hairstyling, clothes and underwear sales, restaurants, and sewing.
Norma is the group’s president. In the photo she is in the first row on the left side wearing a red jacket and a pink scarf, with short hair. She sells American clothing. At weekends she sells in the flea market which is close to her home. She also sells from home and at different sites around and outside of Talca. She has been in this business for three years, and has support from her oldest son and her husband, who help her find places to sell and transport her clothing. Norma has three children but only lives with her daughter who is 17, as her other two children live with their own families. 
Norma will invest this loan into a much larger quantity of clothing to sell. Her dream is to grow her business and to set up a store in her home from which to sell. Norma enjoys working with Kiva partner, Fondo Esperanza, because she feels that the group members are responsible and committed.  Additionally, the workshops about business administration have helped her.
Talca is in the Maule region, located in the central part of Chile. The majority of the population live in rural areas, and dedicate themselves primarily to productive farming activities. Talca is known for its beautiful artisan products and its colonial architecture. The principal attractions are the plants, animals, and vineyards. Despite the fact that the workforce has increased, this region continues to be, according to the latest census, one of the poorest in the country.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase raw materials necessary for the production of pajamas

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Nuevo Amanecer esta conformado por 13 mujeres quienes son luchadoras y lo hacen para buscar la estabilidad económica que sus familias necesitan, se llevan muy bien entre ellas llegando a ser un grupo muy alegre y unido. Vive en la parroquia de Zhidmad que esta ubicada al sur occidente del cantón Gualaceo, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y  ganadería, su producción les sirve solo para el autoconsumo. La población femenina se dedica al tejido de sombreros de paja toquilla, a la elaboración de chompas de lana y al bordado de polleras (faldas) y blusas.  Su gente sale a la ciudad de Cuenca en busca de fuentes de trabajo.

La Señora Jannet Guayllas vive en la comunidad de Zhidmad, se encuentra en su primer ciclo y fue  invitada por su suegra a formar parte de este gran grupo de mujeres organizadas y luchadoras, se dedica  a los quehaceres de su casa y aprovecha para criar animales como: gallinas, cuyes y chanchos, los vende cuando tiene  alguna necesidad económica.

Nuestra socia tiene 27 años, es casada y  tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad que se encuentra estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad, su esposo trabaja como mensajero, con el sacrificio conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia. Es  su primer crédito, lo va a invertir en la compra de más cuyes y así crecer en el negocio. Su sueño es tener un almacén de ropa.

La Señora Rosa T. vive en la comunidad de Zhidmad, tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 10, 7, 4 y 1 año de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estan estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad, su esposo trabaja como cocinero, y con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Nuestra socia es costurera, actividad que viene desempeñando hace 7 años, fue su suegra quien le ha enseñado esta actividad,  borda las polleras (faldas) que son la  vestimenta típica de la región, trabaja bajo pedido todos los días sin tener horario fijo, también se dedica a la cría de animales como: cuyes, chanchos, conejos, que los vende en la ciudad de Cuenca cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. Es nuestra socia hace tres ciclos y los créditos le han beneficiado para comprar animales, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos.

Su meta es  llegar a tener una tienda.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nuevo Amanecer is made up of 13 women who are fighters. They do it to find the financial stability that their families need. They get along very well together and are a very cheerful and close group. They live in the parish of Zhidmad, located in the southwestern part of the Gualaceo canton. People there work in agriculture and cattle, and their production is for subsistence. The female population weaves hats from toquilla straw and makes wool sweaters and embroidered skirts and blouses. The people go to the city of Cuenca to seek work. Mrs. Jannet Guayllas lives in the community of Zhidmad. This is her first cycle and she was invited to be a part of the group by her mother in law, to join these organized and dedicated women. She is a homemaker and raises animals such as: chickens, guinea pigs andpigs. She sells them when she needs the money. Our member is 27 years old, married and has a 6 year old son who is attending a local school. Her husband works as a messenger. With their hard work they have been able to build their own home. This is her first loan. She is going to invest it in buying more guinea pigs and thus grow her business. Her dream is to have a clothing store. Mrs. Rosa T. lives in the community of Zhidmad. She is 30 years old, married and has 4 childres aged 10,7, 4, and 1. Her two oldest children are attending a local school. Her husband works as a cook, and with both their hard work they have been able to build a home. Our member is a seamstress, and has been for 7 years. It was her mother in law who showed her this activity. She embroiders the skirts that are a part of the traditional clothing of the region. She works to order every day without a set schedule. She also raises animals such as guinea pigs, pigs, and rabbits, which she sells in the city of Cuenca when she needs the money. She has been a member for three years and the loans have helped her to buy animals. Her new loan will be invested in buying chickens. Her goal is to be able to have a store.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 28 años, vive con su madre en casa de sus padres. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a realizar bordados para los trajes típicos de su localidad. Desde su misma casa trabaja todos los días y en el horario que más se acondicione a sus necesidades. Su madre de vez en cuando la ayuda en el trabajo, puesto que el trabajo requiere de mucha dedicación si quiere conseguir que estas prendas sean coloridas y con buen acabado. Una vez terminada la labor, es entregada a los clientes que solicitan sus servicios. Disfruta mucho la actividad que realiza, porque este trabajo lo puede hacer en su casa sin presiones, además de que sus bordados son bien cotizados en su zona y más en fechas festivas como es este mes de julio y agosto. Desea para el futuro mejorar sus trabajos e incrementar su producción. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de hilos dorados, plateados y de diversos colores, también comprará nuevos bastidores.
texts.en:
María is 28 years old and lives in her parents' home with her mother. Since she was a child she has been creating the embroidery on the traditional suits from her region. She works everyday from home, so she can set her schedule to best fit her needs. Her mother sometimes helps her, because it takes a lot of work to make the colorful, well-finished garments. Once finished, the suit is delivered to the customer who requested it. María really enjoys her work because she can work at home without pressure. Her embroidery is in high demand locally, especially around holidays such as this July and August. For the future, she hopes to improve her work and sales. This is María's 6th loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has this financial support. She has always been responsible in her loan repayment and is grateful to be a part of her community group because all of the members are responsible and supportive. María is also grateful to those people who will provide the funding for the loan she is requesting. This loan will be very useful in the progress of her business. María will invest in the purchase of gold, silver, and colored thread. She will also buy new embroidery frames (to hold the fabric in place during embroidery).

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various colored thread and embroidery frames.

loans.name: Dorally Andrea

texts.es: Dorally Andrea tiene 50 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de taxi, ella dio inicio por su esposo ya fue por medio del el que la obtuvo, ella busca la mejor manera de administrar su negocio, por lo que desde muy joven ha tenido que aprender a trabajar para mantener a sus hijos y prepararlos y que sean personas de bien. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de materia prima como es reparar la unidad de taxi y realizar la compra de llantas, focos y otros repuestos. Sueña con obtener otro automóvil para trabajar.
texts.en:
Dorally Andrea is 50 years old. She runs a taxi service that she was given by her husband. She is seeking the best way to manage her business. She has desired since she was very young to learn to work to support her children and prepare them to be good people. She is asking for a loan to buy raw materials to repair the taxi and to buy tires lights and other parts. She hopes to obtain another car for the service.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and nutrients necessary for the production of chili peppers

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 64 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. DesD. hace 20 años que tiene una tienda ubicada, negocio que se encuentra en un espacio D. su casa, comercializa diariamente productos D. primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, entre otros. Cada semana se abastece D. mercadería aunque en algunas ocasiones son lo proveedores que van a su establecimiento.  Durante este tiempo D. trabajo, ha visto que  este negocio le ha resultado rentable y afirma que le agrada estar trabajando en su tienda porque le permite estar activa todo el día, es por esa razón que seguirá trabajando por mas años. Es su catorceavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D. saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, utilizará en la compra D. mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
María is 64 years old, and she is the owner of the house she lives in with her husband. About 20 yeas ago she established a shop in a room of her house: here she daily sells products such as rice and sugar, among other everyday necessities. Every week she refurnishes herself with products, and sometimes her suppliers go directly to her shop. In the years she has been working, she has realized that this activity is profitable for her; she states that she likes working in her shop as this activity keeps her busy during the day, and for this reason she will keep on working for many years to come. This is her fourteenth loan with MFP; she is very happy to know she can count on financial support, as she has always demonstrated being responsible with her repayments; she moreover enjoys being part of her communal bank because all of its members are responsible and very caring people. She is thankful to those that will manage the loan she is requesting, which will be very useful in making her activity grow. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products for her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more products to refurnish her shop.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María es viuda, vive a lado de sus 2 hijos en su casa que es propia. Desde hace más de 25 años elabora bellos bordados artísticos para los trajes típicos de su zona. Trabaja en su misma casa, en ocasiones sus hijos la apoyan, ya que este trabajo demanda tiempo y dedicación. Asimismo cría vacas, a las que la extrae la leche y las vende diariamente, todas estas actividades son su fuente de ingresos  para el sostén familiar. Lo que disfruta en mayor medida es bordar sus trajes típicos, es muy creativa y sabe que puede hacer mucha, es por esta razón que continuará dedicándose a este oficio con miras a mejorar cada vez más su producción y venta. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque sabe que todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece además aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de materiales para sus bordados.
texts.en:
María is a widow living with her 2 children in a house that she owns. Fro more than 25 years, she has been producing beautiful artistic embroideries for the typical costumes of her area. She works in her house, and sometimes her children help her, as this is a job that requires time and dedication. On top of this she breeds cows. she milks them everyday and then sells the milk. These activity all generate money she uses to face her family’s necessities. What she likes the most is to embroider her typical costumes: she is very creative and she know she is capable of producing man y of them, and for this reason she will keep ion engaging in this activity, aiming to constantly improving her production and her sales. This is her first credit with MFP, and she is very happy to know she can count on financial support; besides, she likes being a member of her communal bank because she knows that all the members are responsible and very caring people. She is also thankful to those people that will manage the loan she is requesting, as this will be very useful to help her make her activity grow. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy materials for her embroideries.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material for her embroideries.

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es: Mayela tiene 55 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa  propia. Tiene 9 años D. experiencia en la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad en un puesto D. mercado cerca D. su casa, atienD. todas las mañanas hasta la tarD.. La atención que le da al publico es muy cálido y amable, procurando siempre dar un peso exacto y justo a los productos que venD., es así que ha logrado que sus clientes siempre acudan a su establecimiento. En ocasiones su hija mayor y su esposo la ayudan en el trabajo, pero generalmente ella es la única responsable del negocio. Afirma que le agrada atender a sus clientes, ya que es muy comunicativa. Esta actividad  le ha resultado  beneficiosa en las rentas, por lo que desea continuar por muchos años más, con miras a crecer y tener una tienda mayorista D. productos D. primera necesidad en su misma casa. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  además aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, utilizará en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, menestras y fideos que le servirá para  aumentar la mercadería disponible en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mayela is 55 years old. She lives with her husband and their three children in their own house. She has 9 years of experience in the sale of basic products in a market stall near their home. She tends to her shop every day from morning until afternoon. The attention which she gives to the public is very warm and kind, always trying to give an exact and fair weight to all the products that she sells. In this way, she has succeeded in having customers who always come to her shop. Occasionally her oldest daughter and her husband help her in her work, but generally she is the only one responsible for the business. She confirms that it pleases her to assist her customers, since she is very communicative. This business has been beneficial to her income, and for this reason she wants to continue for many more years, with a view to growing and having a wholesale store for basic products in her own home. This is Mayela's fourth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support, since she has always demonstrated that she is responsible with her payments. In addition, she is happy to be part of her community bank because all the members are very responsible and united people. She is also thankful to those people who will be grantors of the loan she is applying for, since it will be very useful in the progress of her business. She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar, dried beans, and pasta, which will increase the merchandise available in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic products to stock her store

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY YUNGAQUI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Anta de la provincia  Anta y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Luisa; ella tiene 60 años de edad y La socia es natural de Iscuchaka, Ella esa casada y tiene 1 hijo, y su conyugue es agricultor y ella se dedica al comercio minorista y compra y vende granos (maíz diferentes variedades, frejol, habs, pallares); La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio, minorista, la socia vende lo que su esposo produce en sus terrenos, el produce maíz y habas, pero también ella compra otros productos secos de otros proveedores, la socia vende en un stand en el mercado de Iscuchaka en el distrito de Anta. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar al por mayor los productos que su esposo no produce y así continuar con su negocio.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Luisa belongs to the community bank "Señor de Ccoyllority Yungaqui". She lives in the district of Anta in the Anta province in the state of Cusco. Luisa is 60 years old and is a native of Iscuchaka. She is married and has one son. Her spouse is a farmer, and she dedicates herself to the retail business. She buys and sells grains (including different varieties of corn, kidney beans, broad beans, and butter beans). Luisa alternates her home activities with her business tasks. She sells what her husband produces on their land, corn and broad beans. However, Luisa also buys dried products from other providers. She sells her products from a stand in the Iscuchaka market, in the district of Anta. Luisa is requesting this loan so that she can purchase at wholesale the products that her husband doesn't produce and in this way continue her business. Luisa values and is very grateful for the loan granted to her since it allows her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. Likewise, she promises to pay back her installments in the time period stipulated.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale the products that her husband does not produce

loans.name: Unidas Somos Mas ( Cuenca ) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Unidas somos más está formado por 9 mujeres quienes luchan día a día para mejora su situacion económica y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. La mayor parte de las socias viven por el sector Nonodel a unos 30 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, realizan sus reuniones en el campo abierto debido a que a sus hogares no es muy accesible que ingrese algún vehiculo.

La Señorita Laura B. vive en el cantón Deleg, es su primer crédito que realiza, fue invitada por su tía que ya pertenece al banco comunal, se dedica a cultivar la tierra trabajando como jornalera.
Nuestra socia es muy joven ya que tiene apenas 19 años de edad es soltera y vive en casa de su hermana compartiendo los gastos, su crédito lo va a invertir en ganado para empezar con este negocio, su meta es  tener  casa propia.

La Señora Hilda B. vive en el cantón Deleg, tiene 26 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos quienes se encuentran de 10, 7, 5, 2 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estan estudiando en una escuela de la localidad, su esposo trabaja labrando la tierra como jornalero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Nuestra socia también se dedica al trabajo del campo como jornalera, labora todos los días de lunes a sábado, pero también se da  tiempo para cuidar a sus animales ya que cría cuyes y pollos, los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica, es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir para pagar la cuota inicial de un terreno que está adquiriendo, su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The community bank Unidas was formed by 9 women who fight day by day to better their economic situation and to improve the quality of life for their families. The majority of the members live in the Nonodel sector, some 30 minutes outside the city of Cuenca. They conduct their meetings in the countryside because their homes are not very accessible by car. Miss Laura B. lives in Deleg canton. This is her first loan that she has used. She was invited by her aunt and now belongs to the community bank. She works cultivating the earth as a farm laborer. She is very young, only 19 years of age, is single and lives at the home of her sister sharing the expenses. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of livestock to start her own business. Her goal is to own her own home. Ms Hilda B. lives in Deleg canton, is 26 years old, and is married with 4 children who are 10, 7, 5, and 2 years of age. Her first 3 children are going to the local school. Her husband works as a farm laborer. The do not have their own home, so they are renting. This member is also working as a farm laborer. She works every day Monday to Saturday, but she also takes time to care for the animals that she raises – guinea pigs and chickens. She sells them when she has economic need. This is her first loan that she is getting from the community bank. It will be invested to pay the down payment on some land that she is acquiring. Her dream is to own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy livestock, downpayment on land

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY YUNGAQUI”; El  socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
El  socio es el Sr. Raúl; el tiene 34 años de edad y El socio es conviviente, estudió la superior incompleta, debido a que debido asumir los gastos económicos de su nuevo hogar, él socio es natural de la comunidad de yungaqui. El socio se dedicaba antes a la compra y venta de palos ahora a él le va mejor el pudo ahorrar y cambio de negocio. Él ahora compra y vende autos de segunda mano. El  socio solicita el préstamo para aumentar su capital de trabajo y comprar un auto de segunda para venderlo a un taxista.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Raúl belongs to the community bank, "Señor de Ccoyllority Yungaqui". He lives in the district of Huanchac in the province of and department of Cusco. Raúl is 34 years old and lives with his partner. He started higher education but was not able to finish because he had to assume the expenses of his new home. Raúl is a native of the community of Yungaqui. He used to dedicate himself to buying and selling posts. However, he was able to save and improve his business. He now buys and sells used cars. Raúl is requesting this loan to increase his working capital and buy a used car so that he can sell it to a taxi driver. Raúl values and is infinitely grateful for the credit offered to him since it helps him to grow his business and improve his quality of life. Likewise, he promises to pay back the installments according to the timetable stipulated.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a used car to sell to a taxi driver

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY YUNGAQUI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Anta de la provincia  Anta y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Felicitas; ella tiene 38 años de edad y La socia es natural de Iscuchaka, Ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia compra y vende leche, ella compra a una señora la leche todos los días a primera hora y los lleva a vender a todo el pueblo hasta que se le acabe, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar al por mayor la leche y pagar una pequeña deuda con su proveedora y está pensando en comprar una vaquita.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Felicitas belongs to the community bank "Señor de Ccoyllority Yungaqui". She lives in the district of Anta in the Anta province in the state of Cusco. Felicitas is 38 years old and is a native of Iscuchaka. She is married and has four children. Felicitas alternates her home activities with her retail business tasks of buying and selling milk. She buys milk from the same woman early in the morning each day and brings it to sell in the town until it runs out. Felicitas is requesting this loan so that she can purchase the milk at wholesale and pay back a small debt that she has with her provider. She is also thinking about purchasing a cow. Luisa values and is very grateful for the loan granted to her since it allows her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. Likewise, she promises to pay back her installments in the time period stipulated.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase milk at wholesale and pay back a small debt that she has with her provider

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY YUNGAQUI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Anta de la provincia  Anta y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Alejandra; ella tiene 49 años de edad y La socia es natural de Iscuchaka, Ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos, la socia no pudo estudiar nunca desde muy pequeña ayudo a sus padres por ser la mayor de 8 hermanos y se puso a trabajar desde muy niña aprendiendo el oficio del comercio minorista,  ella se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores, la socia compra aves de corral y cuyes y los vende una vez que alcanzan la etapa de la madurez para la venta y la reproducción de los mismos.  Su conyugue es agricultor y ella también cuando no tiene este negocio salida vende leche. La socia solicita el préstamo para hacer de el un capital de trabajo y comprar animales para abastecer su negocio. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY YUNGAQUI”, and she lives in the Anta district, Anta province, Cusco department. The member is Mrs. Alejandra, 49, and a native of Isuchaka. She is married and has 3 children. She couldn't go to school because from the time she was very little, she helped her parents because there were 8 children in the family. She began to work since she was a little girl in retail. She buys and sells young animals. She purchases poultry and guinea pigs and sells them when they are grown and ready for breeding. Her partner is a farmer and Alejandra works as a farmer as well. When she isn't doing this work, she sells milk. The member is requesting a loan for working capital to buy animals to stock her business. She values and infinitely appreciates the loan offered her since this will help her increase her business and improve her quality of living, and she promises to make the payments in the scheduled timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan for working capital to buy animals to stock her business.

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY YUNGAQUI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Anta de la provincia  Anta y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Buenaventura; ella tiene 59 años de edad y La socia es natural de Iscuchaka, Ella es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo, la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella compra y vende ropa en confraternidad, ella tiene un stand en este centro comercial, La socia también está interesada en hacer otro tipo de negocio en Iscuchaka, ella quiere vender productos en el mercado de Iscuchaka y está pensando en retomar este proyecto. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This community bank member belongs to the "Senor de Ccoyllority Yungaqui" community bank. She lives in the Anta district in the Anta province in the Cusco region. The bank member is Sra. Buenaventura. She is 59 years old and is a native of Iscuchaka. She is a single mother and has one son. She works in retail sales, buying and selling clothing in a partnership.. She has a stand in the commercial center. She is also interested in having another type of business in Iscuchaka. She wants to sell products in the Iscuchaka market and is thinking about taking up this project again. She is applying for the loan to buy merchandise. She values and is infinitely thankful for the loan granted, since it will permit her to increase her business and improve her quality of life. At the same time, she promises to make her payments on the stipulated dates.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY YUNGAQUI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Anta de la provincia  Anta y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Angela; ella tiene 41 años de edad y La socia es natural de Acomayo, Ella es casada y tiene 1 hijo, , su esposo es agricultor y ella se dedica a  todo tipo de productos agrícolas en el mercado de Iscuchaka, ella vende lo que su esposo cosecha, el siembra maíz de diferentes variedades, también habas, y los otros productos como la papa, chuño, moraya, pallares, frijoles y demás, los compra de otros proveedores. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos secos para la venta. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "Señor de Ccoyllority Yungaqui" communal bank. She lives in the Anta district, in the province of Anta, Department of Cusco. This borrower is Mrs. Angela. She is 41 years old and originally from Acomayo. She is married and has one son. Her husband is a farmer and she works with all types of agricultural products in the Iscuchaka market. She sells what her husband grows. He plants different varieties of corn, as well as fava beans and other products like potatoes, chuño and moraya [freeze-dried potato products], pallares [lima butter beans], and other beans. She also buys from other producers. She is requesting this loan to buy dry goods that she will sell. This borrower values and is infinitely grateful for the loan offered to her, as it will allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. She also promises to comply with her repayment plan.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy dry goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his house he will put up a wall

loans.name: Dorcas
