texts.es: Dorcas tiene  42  años, vive con sus 2 hijos y en su casa propia. Desde hace 5 años se dedica en la venta de prendas de vestir, por lo que viaja mensualmente a la ciudad de Lima para abastecerse de mercadería actual y moderna de acuerdo a la temporada en que se encuentra. Sus ventas lo realizan en su misma ciudad, llevando parte de su mercadería como muestra para asegurar más rápida la venta, de esa manera de trabajar le permite disponer de su horario y no descuidar de sus hijos. Lo más dificultoso de su trabajo es  esperar a que le cancelen sus clientes, por esa razón trata en lo posible de que le paguen al contado el producto que compran. En adelante continuara trabajando con el fin de tener su tienda de ropa en su misma casa. Es su doceavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de más mercadería.
texts.en:
Dorcas, age 42, lives in her own house with her two children. She has been selling clothing for five years. She travels monthly to the city of Lima to stock her business with up-to-date and modern merchandise according to the season. She makes her sales in the same city. She takes part of her merchandise as a sample to ensure more rapid sales. This way of working allows her to arrange her schedule and not neglect her children. The most difficult part of her work is waiting for her customers to pay her. That is why she tries, whenever possible, to be paid in cash for the item that is purchased. In the future she will continue working in order to have a clothing store in her house. This is her 12th loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial backing. She has always demonstrated herself to be responsible in her payments. Also, it pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people. She thanks those individuals who will approve her loan request; the funds will be very useful in advancing her business. She will use the requested loan to buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing to stock her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy construction materials to change the roof of his house and personal expenses

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia  tiene  37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos  en su casa propia. Se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería desde hace 11 años, actualmente posee en su establo vacas, toros y ovejas, además siembra maíz, papa y alfalfa que le sirve para alimentar a sus animales, ya que debe venderlos cuando llegan al peso exacto. Sus mayores ingresos para ella es cuando vende alfalfa, producto por el cual se ha intensificado en su siembra, de esta manera corta todas las mañanas y con la ayuda de sus hijos la ayudan a vender. Afirma que sus actividades le están generando buenas rentas, y esto es gracias a su perseverancia y ahora ve los frutos con mucha satisfacción por lo que esta planeando adquirir mas extensiones de terreno. Es su noveno crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará sacos de abono para sembrar más alfalfa en sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Silvia is 37 years old; she lives with her husband and 2 children in a house they own. She has worked in farming and livestock for 11 years. Currently, Silvia owns a stable of cows, bulls and sheep. She also farms maize, potato and alfalfa, which she uses to feed her animals until they are big enough for sale. Most of her income comes from alfalfa, so she has increased her planting. She harvests the alfalfa every morning, and sells it with the help of her children. Silvia confirms that her work is profitable, thanks to her perseverance. She now sees the fruits of her labor and is happily planning to expand her farm land. This is her 9th loan with MFP. Silvia is happy to have this financial support and she has always been responsible in her loan repayment. She is also grateful to be a part of her community group because all of its members are responsible and supportive. Silvia is grateful to those people whose funding will provide the loan capital she needs. This loan will be very useful in the development of her business. She will use it to buy sacks of fertilizer to plant more alfalfa.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve his home by changing the flooring in one bedroom using tiles.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en casa de unos parientes. Desde hace 2 años realiza bellos bordados, se inicio por invitación de una de sus amigas que la enseñó, ahora trabaja de manera independiente en la comodidad de su casa para poder atender su hogar y sus hijos. Asimismo cultiva alfalfa para poder venderla al por mayor, es por ello que no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo. Pero es muy constante en la realización de sus bordados  ya que  por la complejidad de su trabajo y el grosor del bordado en la tela le quita un mes de trabajo, al final el resultado se a en una bella prenda típica que causa admiración entre sus clientes y finalmente son los que compran al contado. La época más rentable  en su negocio es cuando  están en plena época de festividades llamada “La fiesta de Santiago” que se celebra mucho por su zona. Desea crecer en la producción de faldas bordadas y contratar personal para ayudarla  en esta  producción. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. La razón de su crédito es para poder adquirir mas telas de diversos colores así como  hilos de diversos colores, también comprará semillas y abono para sembrar alfalfa.
texts.en:
Victoria is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and their children in their relatives' house. For the last two years she has been making beautiful embroideries. She started when a friend taught her and she now works independently in the comfort of her home, which allows her to look after the house and her children. She also grows alfalfa to sell wholesale, which is why she does not have a fixed work schedule. However, she is very constant when it comes to her embroideries, as their complexity and thickness on the fabric take a month's work. The end result is a beautiful traditional garment, admired by her customers, who buy in cash. The most profitable period for her business is during the Feast of Santiago, which is widely celebrated in her area. She would like to increase the production of embroidered skirts and recruit more staff to help her. This is her third loan with MFP. She is very happy to have financial backing because she has always proved to be responsible in the management of her payments. She also enjoys being part of her loan group because all members are responsible and very supportive. She thanks those managing the loan request, which will be very helpful in the development of her business. She will use the credit to buy more fabrics and yarns in different colours, as well as seeds and fertilizer for planting alfalfa.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabrics and yarns in different colours.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es: Zenaida tiene 41 años, vive con su  esposo y sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 12 años viene desempeñando sus labores en su fábrica de ladrillos a lado de su esposo que trabajan sin descanso para producir ladrillos  de calidad y en cantidades. Su trabajo es muy duro ya que requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico, su pareja se levanta cada madrugada para  calentar el horno y por las mañanas Zenaida  ayuda en la preparación de la  masa de arcilla para darle forma y serán depositadas luego en los moldes de ladrillo y dejarlas secar en el sol  por  un día entero, y al estar secos se depositan en el horno  para coserse  hasta por el lapso de 24 horas. Afirma que su trabajo es muy sacrificado pero a la vez muy rentable en sus ganancias es por eso que desea tener una fábrica más amplia de ladrillos. Es su catorceavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, utilizará en la compra de materiales necesarios para la fabricación de ladrillos como arena fina, aserrín y cal.
texts.en:
Zenaida, 41, lives with her husband and their five children in their own home. For the past 12 years she has been working alongside her husband in the brick factory they own. They work tirelessly to produce large quantities of quality bricks. It is hard work because it requires much physical effort. Her partner gets up at dawn to heat the oven and in the morning Zenaida helps with the preparation of the clay to shape it. Later it is put in the brick moulds, which are left out to dry in the sun for a whole day. Once dry, the bricks are baked for 24 hours in the oven. She says it is very demanding work but also very profitable, and that is why she wants to have a larger brick factory. This is her loan number fourteen with MFP. She is very happy to have financial backing as she has always proven to be very responsible with her payments. She also enjoys being part of the loan group because all members are responsible and very supportive. She thanks those individuals managing the loan she is requesting as it will be very useful in the development of her business. With the requested loan she will buy the necessary materials for brick manufacture, such as fine sand, sawdust and lime.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for brick manufacture.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa tiene 54 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 10 años  tiene su tienda D. comestibles que le ayudó a mejorar sus actividades  agrícolas y ganaderas. Trabaja todos los días, sus hijos también la ayudan en sus tiempos libres para vender sus productos. Cada semana se abastece D. mercadería para tener siempre su tienda repleta D. productos que tienen mucha demanda por parte D. sus clientes. Este trabajo le ha permitido crecer un poco más en su economía además que disfruta día a día D. realizar esta actividad comercial que se complementa a los trabajos que tiene en la agricultura y crianza D. animales. En adelante desea seguir desarrollando esta actividad hasta tener una tienda más granD. y mejor implementada. Es su treceavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal,  porque todos los integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. mercadería para su tienda, además desea comprar sacos D. abono para sembrar pastizales que es el alimento D. sus animales.
texts.en:
Luisa is 54 years old. She lives with her three children in their own house. For the last ten years she has had a grocery store which helps her with her other businesses: raising crops and animals. She works every day selling her products in the store and her children help her in their free time. Each week she buys more merchandise so that she always has a store full of products that her customers want to buy. This work allows her to improve her economic status little by little and she is appreciative for each day she can do this commercial activity. Her store is a good complement to the work she does in agriculture and raising animals. In the future she would like to develop her store so that she can have a larger and more well stocked store. This is her thirteenth loan with MFP. She is very content knowing that she has financial support. She has always paid her payments responsibly. She is grateful to be a part of a community group as all of the members of the group are responsible and supportive people. With this loan that she is requesting she will buy merchandise for her store. She would also like to buy sacks of fertilizer in order to grow grasses that are used for food for the animals.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products for her store

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina tiene 39 años, vive con sus padres y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la ganadería, agricultura y comercialización de productos, de esta manera distribuye su tiempo, es una mujer muy activa, todos los días por las tardes atiende a sus animales, y por las mañanas atiende a sus clientes, por ellos procura tener mercadería en su establecimiento, asimismo cuida de sus hijos. En ocasiones sus padres la apoyan en estas actividades, es así que se esfuerza en su trabajo. Disfruta mucho de su trabajo porque tiene ingresos, es por eso que tiene grandes deseos de seguir mejorando. Es su treceavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece además aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, será destinado en la compra de mercadería para su tienda, así como la compra de una res.
texts.en:
Martina is 39 years old. She lives with her parents and three children in their own house. For the past twelve years she has worked in ranching, farming and selling products. This is how she spends her time. She is a very active woman. Every evening she takes care of her animals and in the morning she attends to her customers. Her customers buy merchandise from a store in her home. At the same time she cares for her children. At times her parents help her with her activities. In this manner she is able to do her jobs. She enjoys her work as she makes a profit. It is because of this that she wants to continue improving her business. This is her thirteenth loan with MFP. She is glad to have the financial support and she has always paid her payments responsibly. She is grateful for the community group, as all the members are responsible and supportive. She is also thankful for the people that manage the money for the loan that she is requesting. They are very useful with helping her grow her business. With this loan that she is requesting she will buy merchandise for her store such as buying beef.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda B. is from the village of Cabisera 5. She is 37 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Imelda joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Abbey Joyce

texts.en:
Abbey Joyce C. is from the village of Minante 2, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 29 years old, married, and has three young children. To make a living, Abbey Joyce owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for fattening and sale. Abbey Joyce has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Abbey Joyce joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel T. is from the village of Cabisera 5. She is 32 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Maribel owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Maribel has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Maribel joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard C. is from the town of Surallah. He is 32 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. He owns a jeepney (small bus) that he uses for public transport. Aside from that, he also manages a rice farm and raises hogs for fattening. He says he wants to have a stable income so he can sustain his family, especially his children's education. He wants them to be given proper education and someday finish college. 

Richard joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Richard is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories for the jeepney, as well as farm supplies and feed for the pigs. This will be his 3rd loan from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

She also runs a sari-sari store where basic daily needs are sold. She hopes to have a stable income so she can sustain her children's education.

Jeane joined Kiva partner CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeane has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jeane is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and store supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jeane from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and store supplies.

loans.name: Elina

texts.en: Elina is a 49 year-old married lady with six children who go to school.  She makes and sells laundry soap and detergents to earn a living.  She has been in the this business for six years and her business has really grown through Faulu Kenya.  This is because she uses her savings with a group in Faulu Kenya to invest in her business.  She previously took out a loan of 30, 000 KES to boost the business.  She has requested another loan of 50, 000 KES to buy chemicals and detergents for making soap.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and detergents for making soap

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is a talented musician with extensive experience in leading a choir. Due to life circumstances, she had to leave that pursuit in order to obtain a more stable income. Today, Tamara is an enthusiastic and lively entrepreneur selling women’s clothing and shoes at the open market in Berdyansk city.

With certainty and hard-work, she has been able to develop her business and see it prosper over the last 10 years. Tamara has 30,000 UAH invested in products; her monthly income comes to around 6,000 UAH.

Today, Tamara is excited about the opportunity to replenish her stock with seasonal summer items and has requested a loan of 10,000 UAH. She believes this investment will help her meet the needs of her customers and encourage them to return and shop with her again.

loans.use: To increase the stock selection.

loans.name: Rock Of Ages-Jinja Group

texts.en:
John T.'s calling card for the last four years has been that he always tries to make a favorable and lasting impression on his customers. This is why his shop in Busana-Lugazi has been having a roaring business. The good rapport he has struck with his clientele is responsible for the good 350,000 shillings his business generates in a month. 

John began this business with savings from his previous fishing business. He, like many other retail business people, also operates a commercial motorcycle business commonly known as "boda boda". With this loan, he wants to buy in bulk and restock his retail shop with highly desirable domestic items such as soap, plastics, sugar and salt.

loans.use: To purchase bulk items such as sugar and salt.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba N. is a hairdresser in Abura. She has received junior high education. She is married to a miner and has two children.

Aba has been a hairdresser for fifteen years and supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more hair creams and other hair products to use on her customers’ hair.

Aba hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a steam dryer.

loans.use: To buy more hair creams and other hair products to use on her customers' hair

loans.name: Aliena

texts.en:
Aliena B., a 57-year old married woman who supports her family through her fishing business, lives in Prk. Bangkal, Brgy. Bulanon, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. A member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998, she has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing business, Aliena is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8000.

Aliena is now borrowing PHP 23000 in order to repair her fishing boat and add to her working capital. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 23000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Aliena aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additonal capital and repair of fishing boat

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa A. is a widow with no children. She has not received any form of education.

Adjoa smokes fish as well as fries some for sale in Abura. She has been in this business for five years and uses her income to take care of herself.

Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to process (smoke) for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to process (smoke) for sale

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna E., a married woman who lives in Prk. Pine Tree, Brgy. Bulanon, Sagay City, Negros Occidental, earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and a fishing business. Her husband, 42-year-old Rogelio E. Jr., works as a fishermen and assists in his wife's business activities. They have four children ranging from 11 to 22 years old.

Myrna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Myrna has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 22000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10000, uplifting the family's standard of living.

This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 24000 to buy additional supplies for her sari-sari (general) store as well as materials to make some repairs to her house. Myrna E. is a Dungganon woman, following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bukiro Women's Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
M. Hellen, aged 61, is a hardworking and die-hard agriculturalist who has been maintaining a banana, cattle and coffee plantation for more than 41 years in her home area of Kabukokyero. This fetches her 400,000 UGX per month from milk and banana sales though not enough to sustain her family of 11 children as some are still students at higher institutions of learning.
Hellen has persevered to keep her business enterprise growing. Her aim in taking up this loan is to buy mulches and fertilizer for her plantation and employ additional laborers as she plans to expand and transport her products to bigger markets. This will help her increase productivity, earn more revenue, and live a more sustaining life.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, mulches and labor for her plantation

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. is single. She has no formal education. Esi sells saucepans, plastic bows and other things in Abura. She has been doing this for two years. Esi uses her income to pay for her accommodation and utility bills. Esi will use this loan to purchase more cooking utensils and plastic products for resale. Esi plans to save the new earnings from her extended trade to buy a shop where she can display her goods.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking utensils and plastic products for resale

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie P. is a married woman who lives in the village of Tapon in the municipality of Dalaguete in Cebu Province. She earns her living by operating two businesses: fishing and a food vending business. Her husband, Eduardo P., who is 30 years old, works as a bill collector to earn his living. They have two children; one child is 8 months old and the other is 8 years old.

Rosemarie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005, because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosemarie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 12,000 PHP, raising her family's standard of living. This time, for her twelfth loan, she is borrowing 17,000 PHP to add to her working capital in order for her to continue saving for the future education of her children and the acquisition of assets. Rosemarie P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than 1 USD a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For additional capital and to buy additional materials in fishing

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita P. is a widow who lives in the village of Bogo in the municipality of Argao in Cebu Province. She earns her living by operating a weaving business. She has eleven children who are 10 to 35 years old. 

Conchita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005, because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Conchita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 13,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 9600 PHP, raising her family's standard of living. This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing 14,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital and to buy new equipment for her business in order to continue saving for the future of her family. Conchita P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie M. is a 55-year-old, married woman who supports her family by buying and selling bananas. She lives in the village of General Luna in the municipality of Toboso in Negros Occidental Province.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1996, and she has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her banana business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 4000 PHP.

Rosemarie is now borrowing 14,000 PHP to add to her working capital and to buy more bananas to sell. This will be her seventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 14,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rosemarie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). loans.use: To add to her working capital and to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Tweyombekye Women's Ntungamo Group

texts.en:
Her social and affable nature has been her winning calling card in the 20 years she has been operating her stationary business in Ntungamo town. Her experience in this business has taught her the virtue of being cordial to your clientele.

Given the nature of her business where competition is cutthroat, this has come in really handy for the 56-year-old B. Kellen, a mother of eight, who divulges she has been able to make commendable strides in the improvement of her family’s welfare. Ever since she began her business where she prints, types, binds and photocopies the client’s information alongside selling reams of paper, pens, files, clip boards and other things.

On a weekly basis, she says she makes 300,000 Ugandan shillings as profit. With this amount of money she has managed to educate all of her eight children. Her future plans are to elevate her financial status through the expansion of her business. With this loan she says she wants to buy a computer and also expand her operating area.

loans.use: Business expansion and buying a computer.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort F. is married to a carpenter and takes care of six dependants. She buys fresh fish and smokes them for sale in Abura. Comfort helps her husband meet the basic needs of the family with the income she makes from her sales. Comfort will add the loan she is going to received to her own capital to enable her to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. Comfort plans to reinvest in her business, should there be any form of increase as a result of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. sells salted fish, onions and kenkey (fermented corn dough) in Abura. Ekua has a senior high school education. She is married to a driver. She helps her husband to take care of themselves. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She wishes to save the new revenues from her business to complete her kitchen.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina S. is a married woman who lives in Bog-ot, Argao, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures; pig fattening and a general store business. Her husband, Cirilo S., who is 48 years old, works as a cook to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  Their only child is now 23 years old.

Marcelina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marcelina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP,  uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th loan cycle, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital to expand her pig fattening business and to buy more stock for her general store so that she could continue to save up for future for the betterment of her business. Marcelina S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba E. is a fish monger from Abura. She has received a junior high school education. She is married and living with her five dependants. Her husband is a farmer. She helps her husband by taking care of the family with the profit she makes from her trade. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to smoke for distribution. She hopes to save the profits from her business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more fish to smoke for distribution

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes N. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Jolomaynon, Dalaguete, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures;  pig fattening and a general store business. Her husband, Alex N., who is 29 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have a one-year-old child. 

Agnes joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past two loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Agnes has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 7,000 PHP helped her increase her monthly profit to 6,000 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 3rd loan cycle, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional capital to buy feeds and more pigs so that she can continue to save up for her future and for the future of her son. Agnes N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia P. is a widow who lives in Prk. Venus, Brgy. Patao, Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: buying and selling dried fish, buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes and raising hogs. She has eight children who range from 7 to 30 years old. Virginia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Virginia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 19th loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for her dried fish business so that she can continue to save up for the future for the education of her children. Virginia P. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua K. sells fresh cassava and fish in Abura. She has no educational background. She is a single parent taking care of four children and is responsible for paying her children’s tuition fees and utility bills.

Efua’s loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi D. is married to a sawmill operator and lives with her five dependents. Her educational background is senior high school.

Esi moves around Abura selling watermelon that has been cut into sizable portions and uses her income to support her husband in providing for the general welfare of the home.

Esi will use the loan to purchase more watermelon and other kinds of fruit to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to buy a shop.

loans.use: To purchase more watermelon and other kinds of fruit to sell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena F. sells fresh tomatoes as well as canned tomatoes, garden eggs (eggplant), plantain and pepper at Abura. Abena has been through senior high school. She lives with her husband, who is a driver, and five children.

Abena has been in this trade for ten years. She responsibly supports her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to use the new income from her business to save to buy a shop at the market to sell her goods in.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Joelita

texts.en: Joelita R. is a 39-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: fishing and a general store. She lives in Prk. Angas, Brgy. Casay, Dalaguete, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing and general-store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 24,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Joelita is borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can add to her working capital. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Joelita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. loans.use: Additional capital and buying additional fishing matrerials

loans.name: Kyosimba-Onaanya Women's Group Buikwe-Lugazi

texts.en:
Before she began her food-selling business 12 years ago in Buikwe in Lugazi, Hadijah N. was more of a  business rolling stone. She subsisted on occasional pieces of work, like the selling of second-hand clothing to the selling of food. At present, 48-year-old Hadijah N. is a master at her food-selling business. 

Hadijah is a married mother to two children and in a week she makes 100,000 shillings. With this loan, she wants to reinvigorate her business with bulk  purchases of lucrative cash crops like sweet potatoes, cassava and maize, that she will, in the course of transacting, resell.

loans.use: The purchase of lucrative cash crops like cassava and sweet potatoes for resale

loans.name: Ntungamo Bakyara Tuhirirwe, Ntungamo Group

texts.en:
This story is connected to one K. Aminah from Kyamate ward, Ntungamo, who has been in the agricultural sector for more than 30 years.  Thus we say that different types of agricultural activities have made many Ugandan families have an improved lease on life.

This widowed lady has subsisted on a variety of agricultural products for the last 10 years, specializing in growing bananas and looking after cows. Though adverse weather conditions have constantly affected her plantations, she has managed to consolidate the gains she has made. As a result, her family of 7 children has enjoyed the benefits; principally, her children have all gone to good institutions of learning and at the moment only one is still studying. 

Aminah reveals that in a month she makes close to, or even more than, 200,000 Ugandan shillings from selling her agricultural products. She is very upbeat that, with this loan, she will be in a position to improve on the mulching and gardening aspects of her farm and also increase the stock of animals on her farm, which will help her increase the produce and sales revenue.

This will provide a base for her to meet her motive of educating all her children and also to construct a family house.

loans.use: Mulch for the plantation and restocking the farm with more cows

loans.name: Nyamuhani Twimukye, Ntungamo Group

texts.en:
If one subsists on agriculture like one N. Meldah has found out, you need enormous reserves of patience to succeed. That particular attribute has manifestly worked in her favor.

She speaks with pride of how their 2 children can all attain education. Her proficiency in attending to the banana plantation for the last 2 years in Ntungamo, alongside her produce business of selling beans, ground nuts and more food stuffs, has bore her fruits of economic development.

In a month, she makes profits that help her with her family and the only major drawn-out problem that has plagued her business has been the persistent low banana market prices in villages and that she has no ready means of transporting her produce to bigger markets.

It’s her reckoning that this loan will come in handy in helping her enhance her banana plantation on a large scale through mulching and the buying of fertilizer and, further, allow her to buy additional food stuffs like beans into her produce business for resale on a profit basis.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and mulches for the plantation and more grocery products

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy W. is thirty-five years old, married and has two children aged sixteen and six years old. Her business is located at Taveta Road, in a very busy street in the city centre of Nairobi and is well known by the name Royle Enterprises.

She sells skirt suits, trouser suits, ladies tops, jeans, skirts, shoes and shawls to the customers within the city centre.  Most of her customers are walk-ins although she also has some loyal repeat customers. She has been in this business for the last five years and she says the business is profitable. She says that the business is very good and the only major challenge she has is changes in fashion. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to ensure that her business is doing well.

She is taking a loan of 50,000 KES to up her stock of clothes to meet the needs of her customers. In future, she sees herself building her own house and will have opened more boutiques. She describes herself as hardworking, ambitious and outgoing.

loans.use: Clothing

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua A. is married and has five dependents. She has no educational background. Her husband is a mason.

Efua sells cassava in Abura by moving from one locality to another. She has been in this business for four years and uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Efua will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to get a place in the market to sell her things.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is married and has six dependents. She has received junior high education. Her husband is a security man.

Adwoa sells kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) and also cracks stones in Abura for building constructors. She uses the income she makes from cracking stones to support her husband in taking care of her family.

Adwoa will use the loan to order more stones to crack for her demanding customers. With the new earnings from her expanded business, she plans to save to change her business.

loans.use: To order more stones to crack for her demanding customers

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama M. fries doughnuts to sell in Abura. She is married and has seven dependants. She has no formal education. Her husband is a farmer. Ama uses her income to help her husband pay school fees and utility bills. Ama will use this loan to purchase more flour and other ingredients to prepare doughnuts. She plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business into her business so she can also distribute doughnuts for other people to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more flour and other ingredients to prepare doughnuts to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary W. K. is 49 years old and single. She has two children, ages 21 and 18. Her business office is located at Moi Avenue on a very busy street in the city center in Nairobi and is well-known by the name Malex Properties. She does real estate and builds stalls to rent out to business people. She has been in this business for the last five years, and she says the business is profitable. She says that the business is very good, and the only major challenge she has is convincing the customers that they will make income to pay the stall's rent. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to ensure that her business is doing well. She is taking a loan of 50,000 KES in order to build a stall to rent out to business people. In the future, she sees herself building another house and buying herself a car. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To build a stall

loans.name: Tukore Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
It's hard to imagine that T. Stanley, in his late 50s, has been running an agricultural enterprise for over 30 years and is still at his best, proving to his fellow businessmen that he can make it. Having been inspired and trained by a parent for quite some time, hardworking Stanley got a vision to start up a banana plantation, as well as a business selling bananas and coffee. He has been practicing this from Kyakahesi, where he gets 150,000 UGX on a monthly basis from mobile buyers.

Stanley's main drawback is harvesting poor quantities. However, with this loan he will be able to purchase mulch and manure for his plantation. This will make it possible for him to earn more revenue and to cater for his family of seven school-going children and wife at home. It will also allow him to go for his goal of buying more land and owning a vehicle for transportation purposes.

loans.use: To purchase mulch and manure for his plantation

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. sells rice and tinned tomatoes in Abura. Esi has received a senior high school education. She is married to a driver and has one child. She responsibly supports her husband in providing the basic needs of her family. Her loan will be added to her business income to buy more of her goods to sell. She wishes to reinvest her new profits into her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama M. operates a provisions shop in Abura. She is a single parent taking care of one child. She has been in this business for three years. She is able to take care of her self and her child with the profit she makes from her sales. Her loan will be used to buy extra provisions. Her thinking is that her loan (which she hopes will yield great profit) will be used to buy land.

loans.use: To buy extra provisions for sale in the market

loans.name: Mukisa Womens Group-Jinja

texts.en: M. Zulaika is on the shady side of 30 – to be exact, he is 32 years old. At this young age he already has five children. After much thought, he rationalized that taking care of his children would require doing some kind of business. With firm conviction and with a small amount of savings from his milk-selling business, he began a retail business in Butiki-Jinja. His business generates profits of 250,000 UGX per week. With these kind of profits, Zulaika has made a satisfactory rate of progress in his business. As an alternative source of profit he still operates his milk-selling business. With this loan, he wants to purchase more general merchandise retail items such as soap, salt, plastics and sugar.

loans.use: To purchase more stock, such as soap, salt, sugar and plastics

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba B. sells doughnuts in Abura. She has received a senior high school education. She is married and has seven dependants. Her husband is a plumber. She has been selling doughnuts for ten years now. She is responsible for helping her husband take care of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more flour and other ingredients to prepare doughnuts for sale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business and to educate her children as well.

loans.use: To buy more flour and other ingredients to prepare doughnuts for sale

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa D. sells secondhand bed sheets at Abura. Adjoa has been through junior high school. She is married and takes care of six children. Her husband is a mortuary attendant.

Adjoa has been dealing in secondhand goods for four years now. Her loan will be used to buy bales of secondhand clothes to sell. She hopes to use the new revenues from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy bales of secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba T. is married and has five dependents. She has not received any form of education. Her husband is a stone quarrier.

Araba cracks stones for sale, selling them mostly to builders at Abura. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase extra stones for distribution.

With the new earnings from her expanded business, Araba plans to save to provide a meaningful education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase extra stones for distribution

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena A. is married and has four children. She has no educational background. Abena is a stone cracker in Abura. Her husband is a farmer.  Abena uses her income to help her husband pay for her family's tuition fees and utility bills.  

Abena will use the loan to purchase extra stones to crack and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to save to buy land.

loans.use: To purchase more stones to crack and sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy N. is 43 years old, single, and has three children aged between 11 and 14 years old. She sells food and fruit to walk-in customers in the city centre and her business is well known by the name Tutus Cafe. She has been in this business for the last five years.
Lucy says that business is very good and profitable. The only major challenge she has is lack of enough food supplies to make food for customers. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to ensure that her business does well. Lucy is taking a loan of 50,000 KES to replenish her stock of food items to enable her to make enough food to satisfy her customers' needs. In the future, she sees herself opening a hotel. She describes herself as hardworking and busy.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to make food for customers

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. is a married woman who, together with her husband, takes care of two children. She has received junior high education. Her husband is a driver.

Esi sells maize and gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava) at Abura and uses the earnings from her sales to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Esi will use the loan to purchase more bags of cereals for sale.

With the new profits she is going to earn as a result of the loan, Esi will put up a structure to keep her goods in since she currently keeps them in her room.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of cereals to sell

loans.name: Adoa

texts.en:
Adoa B. is married and has four children. She has no educational background. Her husband is a driver.

Adoa sells gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava) and is a stone-cracker at Abura. She has been cracking stone for a year which builders come to buy from her from time to time. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Adoa will use the loan to order more stones to crack and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To order more stones to crack to sell

loans.name: Buliisa Kwegata, Mubende Group

texts.en:
Sennyonga J., aged 36, is a peasant farmer who grows food crops such as beans and maize to sell to produce and grocery dealers. He is very hardworking and his ambition is to own a big agricultural farm in his home area of Buliisa, Mubende.
J. has developed a strong attribute of determination that, along with his strong, hardworking attitude, has played into his hands, giving his ten-year enterprise a dependable niche. With monthly profits to the tune of 200,000 UGX, J. believes that the sky is the limit for what he intends to achieve. With this loan, he hopes to purchase fertilizers to improve his farm as well as pesticides as pests have affected crops hence reducing yields. This will improve his yields and sales revenue and enable him to live a more satisfying life.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Cesily

texts.en:
Cesily W. K. is 30 years old, married, and has two children aged five months and five years old. Her business is located at Imenti House, a very busy building in Nairobi city centre. Cesily sells suits, shirts and ties to male customers within the city centre. Most of her customers are walk-ins although she also has some loyal repeat customers.
Cesily has been in this business for the last four months and says that business is very good and profitable. The only major challenge she has is that there are so many people in the area operating the same kind of business so customers are spoiled for choice. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to ensure that her business does well. Cesily is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to restock her clothing business to meet the needs of her customers.
In the future, she sees herself becoming a millionaire and having a very happy life with her family. She describes herself as hardworking, talkative and determined.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, such as suits, for resale

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi N. K. is 26 years old, married, and has one child aged four and half years old. Her business is located at Muthurwa, a very busy open-air market on the outskirts of Nairobi city centre. She sells clothes and CDs to walk-in customers. She has been in this business for the last three years. Naomi says that business is very good and profitable. The only major challenge she has is that there are so many people in the area operating the same kind of business so customers are spoiled for choice. However, Naomi works very hard from early morning to late evening to ensure that her business does well. She is requesting a loan of 60,000 KES to add to her stock of clothes to meet her customers' needs.
In the future, Naomi sees herself importing clothes for resale by herself and owning her own plot where she will build a house. She describes herself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair and improve his home.

loans.name: Abigael

texts.en:
Abigael M. M. is 27 years old, married and has one child aged 20 months. Her business is located in Makadara, in a residential area opposite a busy road near the town council office, and is well-known by the name Unique Hair Salon. She serves local women by doing their hair. She also sells braids, hair weaves and hair relaxers to the local women. 

Most of her customers are repeat customers, although she also has some walk-in customers. She has been in this business for the last four years and she says the business is profitable. She says that the business is very good and the only major challenge she has is business space. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to ensure that her business is doing well. 

She is taking a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to boost her stock of braids, chemicals and weaves to meet the needs of her customers. In the future, she sees herself building her own house, educating her child and having a very happy family. She describes herself as hardworking, ambitious and determined.

loans.use: Hair additions (braids), relaxers and hair treatments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will buy thirty units of Tropigas.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex M. Kibe is forty-nine years old, married, and has five children aged between twenty five years old and fifteen years old. His business office is located near the Koja mosque, in a very busy street in the city centre in Nairobi and is well known by the name Malex real estate. He does real estate and rentals. He has been in this business for the last five years and he says the business is profitable. He says the business is very good and the only major challenge he has is customers not paying rent on time. However, he works very hard from early morning to late evening to ensure that his business is doing well. He's taking out a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to build a stall to rent out to business people. In the future, he sees himself building another house. He describes himself as hard-working.

loans.use: building a stall to rent

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M. M. is forty one years old, single and has two children aged twenty two years old and nineteen years old whom she hopes to give a quality university education. Her business is located at Choka, near a very busy highway in Nairobi. She sells timber, twisted bars, galvanised iron pipes, paints, nails, water pipes, taps, cement, iron sheets, bolts and other items to local builders. Most of her customers are loyal repeat customers and walk-ins. 

She has been in this business for the last nine months and she says the business is profitable. She says that the business is very good and the only major challenge she has is slow moving stock as potential customers do not purchase building materials since they fear to build because of land ownership issues. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to ensure that her business is doing well. She is taking a loan of  50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to replenish her stock of iron sheets, water pipes and nails. In future she sees herself build her own business premise in which she will be serving thousands of customers. She describes herself as hardworking, ambitious and determined.

loans.use: iron sheets, water pipes and nails

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Orlando Felix

texts.es: El Sr. Orlando, el vive en zona radial 26 por el Barrio 24 de Septiembre, de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, cuentan con casa propia en la cual vive con tres de sus hijos que dos ya son estudiantes universitarios y el ultimo se encuentra en el colegio, su esposa solo se dedica a labores del hogar, llego a nuestra oficina por referencia de un compañero de trabajo que al igual que el son buenos clientes, don Orlando tiene un microbus propio del cual trabaja haciendo servicios transporte urbano el cual tiene ingresos para sustento de su familia y cubrir su obligaciones financieras, el prestamo solicitado sera destinado para la compra de una caja de cambio para su micro, "estoy muy agradecido con su institucion por la confianza que depositada en mi persona" fueron las palabras del cliente.
texts.en:
Mr. Orlando lives in the neighborhood Radial 26, near the neighborhood 24 de Septiembre in the city of Santa Cruz. They have their own home where they live with their 3 children, 2 that are university students and the last is in High School. His wife works only in the home. He came to our offices with a reference from a coworker, who like him is a good client. Mr. Orlando has his own mini-bus that he uses to perform urban transport services, which is how he has an income to support his family and pay for their financial obligations. The loan he is asking for will be used to buy a change box for the mini-bus. “I am very grateful to this institution for the confidence they have placed in me” were the words of the client.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy a change box for the mini-bus

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Gastos personales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es:
Marta Lorena mujer emprendedora, madre de tres hijos, comerciante desde hace unos años, toma la iniciativa de poner una pequeña pulpería logrando así, ganar dinero para aportar con los gastos del hogar.

Cuando inicio lo hizo con dinero de una venta de vehiculo, y se ha fortalecido con financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado.
Lo que ha invertido en  mercadería de productos. Ya que comenzó con poco capital.
Lo que comprara con este préstamo será granos básicos en la compra de dos quintales de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, bidón de aceite, cajas de jabón, golosinas, lácteos, pollo. Logrando a si aumentar el inventario lo que tendrá ventas altas, y mejores ganancias para cubrir los gastos básicos como personales.
texts.en:
Marta Lorena is a very enterprising woman and the mother of three children. Having been a businesswoman for several years, she took the initiative to start a small general store so that she could earn enough money to pay for household expenses. She started with the money she got from the sale of a vehicle and solidified herself with the financing that Afodenic has given her, which she invested in products and merchandise. She will use the money from this loan to buy basic grains and two quintals of rice, beans, sugar, corn, a drum of cooking oil, boxes of soap, snacks, milk products, and poultry. This will allow her to increase her store’s inventory, which will give her increased sales and income that she can use to cover her basic and personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invertira en la compra de productos basicos, de arroz, frijoles, azucar,aceite, golosinas, lacteos entre otros productos para incrementar las ventas.

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Modou F. est un habitant  du quartier de Daroukhoudosse situe  dans la localité de Guediawaye. Il est âgé  de 53 ans. C’est un  polygame  qui gère  une famille de 4 enfants. 
C’est  son statut de chef de famille qui l’a  conduit à choisir l’activité de chauffeur urbain car  il a l’obligation d’entretenir  ses enfants. Ainsi monsieur F. dispose d’un taxi qu’il exploite depuis 15 ans. Ses charges familiales  ne lui permettant pas de renouveler  son véhicule  qui est devenu vieux maintenant  il sollicite un crédit  de 300 000 frs qui va lui permettre de le réfectionner  afin de maintenir le confort minimum pour les clients.
Le souhait de monsieur F. est  d’accroitre ses gains  et de parvenir à assurer convenablement les frais de scolarité  de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Modou F. lives in the Daroukhoudosse quarter of Guediawaye. He is 53. He is a polygamist and runs a household with 4 children. His position as head of the family drew him to become a taxi driver, because he has the obligation to support his children. Thus Mr. F. has been driving a taxi for 15 years. His familial responsibilities don’t allow him to maintain his taxi, which has gotten old. He now seeks a loan for 300,000 frs, which will allow him to make repairs in order to maintain a minimum comfort level for his clients. Mr. F. wishes to increase his earnings and to manage to properly pay for his children’s education.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es:
Doña Maria es una madre esforzada para sus hijos, trabajadora desde su juventud.
Desde hace más de un año,  tiene un trabajo fijo como conserje, ya que anteriormente se dedicaba solo a la venta de cosméticos. Pero las ventas no le estaban dando el resultado ya que estaban bajas y los clientes no le estaban pagando en la fecha indicada.
Lo que se le había hecho difícil, lo que logra encontrar trabajo fijo, y poder  cubrir sus gastos alimenticios, como gastos básicos. 
A través de estos préstamos ha logrado hacer las mejoras de su casa, ya que con el préstamo anterior logro cambiar el techo. 
Y ahora hará un anexo en los cuartos, en donde comprara: doscientos bloques, dos metros de arena, piedrin, cemento, hierro para comenzar.
Y seguir beneficiándose a través de estos financiamientos.
texts.en:
Maria is a dedicated mother who makes a great effort for her children. She's been a hard worker since her childhood. For more than a year she has had steady work. She used to only sell cosmetics, but her sales were not successful, they were low, and her customers were not paying her on the dates promised. It was difficult for her to find steady work and be able to cover all of her food and basic expenses. These loans have made it possible for her to make improvements to her home and the previous one allowed her to replace her roof. Now she wants to add a room and she needs to buy 200 cinder blocks, two meters of sand, gravel, cement, and iron bars in order to begin and continue to benefit from these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy silver rings, bracelets, earrings as well as cell phones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 10 zinc sheets, 8 pipelines and 50 stones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize, firewood and and a comal (typical Mexican griddle)

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Luis Alvarado G. es padre de 4 pequeños a los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. Por tercera ocasión pide del apoyo a esta institución para hacerle algunos arreglos a su vivienda; Carlos agradece por el préstamo que se le dio ya que es de la única manera que invierte en el patrimonio familiar. 
El proyecto que tiene en este momento es enjarrar y terminar de construir una barda, que hace años no la hizo para ayudar a su vecino en temporadas de lluvias pasara el agua y no se quedara estancada  pero ahora  a Carlos esta teniendo problemas ya que su vivienda se esta trasminando el agua es por ello que quiere hacer esto antes de que tenga un problema mayor. El trabaja en un restaurante-bar para cubrir los gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos Luis Alvarado Garcia is the father of 4 small children to whom he wants to offer a better life. For the 3rd time he is asking for support from this institution to do some repairs to his home. Carlos is grateful for the loan that he was given as it is the only way he has of investing in his family’s personal assets. The current project is plastering and finishing building a walled fence, which he has not done for years because he was helping his neighbor in the rainy seasons so that the water would pass through and not stay stagnant. But now Carlos is having problems because his house is leaking water and he wants to repair it before it becomes a major problem. He works in a restaurant-bar to cover the expenses of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: constructing a fence

loans.name: Jenny Agustin

texts.es:
Doña Jenny es una mujer trabajadora, de oficio maestra el cual ha sido  su trabajo fijo, también comerciante, de ropa, zapatos, con tres hijos, y su esposo el cual trabaja también como docente.

Juntos han logrado hacer su casa, apoyar a sus hijos, y con los financiamientos que la institución ha dado, ha logrado las mejoras de la casa.
Tiene en proyecto la terminación de un muro solo le falta una parte, el cual el objetivo de este préstamo es para comprar materiales de construcción como: hierro, cemento, piedrin, arena y piedra.
Logrando a si terminar su muro que será de una mejor seguridad.
Contenta por el apoyo que ha recibido para hacer este proyecto ya que es difícil hacer todo al contado por lo caro que esta todo.
texts.en:
Jenny is a hard working woman. She is a teacher by profession and this has been her regular job. She is also a merchant, selling clothes and shoes. She has three children and a husband, who is also a teacher. Together they have been able to build their house and support their children. With the financing the institution has given them, they have been able to make improvements on the home. She has a project finishing a wall and there is only one part left to do. The objective of this loan is to buy construction materials such as: iron, cement, gravel, sand and stone. By finishing the wall, there will be more security. She is happy with the support she has received to do this project since it is difficult to pay for everything upfront because it is all so expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as: stone, sand, cement and iron to finish building a wall, which will provide more security for the family.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: Sergio M. Z. quiere poner lo cimientos para iniciar a construir un cuarto en su vivienda para ofrecer a su familia un mayor espacio y confort. Su casa el la construyo con ahorros propios que ya se termino en lo cual el requiere del apoyo de capital para poder terminar su proyecto. Sergio y su esposa son personas trabajadoras y responsables.
texts.en:
Sergio M. Z. wants to lay the cement to start construction of a room on his house so that his family will have more space and comfort. He built his house with his own savings but they are now gone, and now he needs help with some capital so that he can finish the project. Sergio and his wife are hard-working and responsible people.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cement for a room

loans.name: Ma. Trinidad

texts.es: Ma. Trinidad Vázquez  C. es una mujer emprendedora desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en una de las pulgas muy conocidas de la ciudad; lugar donde mucha gente recurre. La señora ya tiene cliente los cuales la van recomendado por su carácter tan amable al atender y la calidad que ofrece de su producto. La señora Trinidad desea comprar más mercancía para su negocio para tener mas variedad y así generar mas ventas.
texts.en:
María Trinidad Vázquez C. is an enterprising woman. For the last four years she has sold used clothing in one of the city’s best known flea markets, a place many people come to. She has customers that recommend her because of her kind manner and the quality of the goods she offers. Trinidad would like to buy more merchandise to stock her business with a larger variety thereby generating more sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Lucina

texts.es:
Lucina M. E. cuenta con un negocio de abarrotes llamado “Miscelánea M.”  con una antigüedad de 3 años ofreciendo mejor producto y a un bajo precio. 
Para seguir teniendo su negocio lleno de variedad requiere de un préstamo para comprar más mercancía para seguir teniendo fluidez de clientes que se vayan satisfechos con el producto que compren. Su esposo la apoya ergonómicamente aparte de ser pensionado trabaja como transportista de camiones para trasladar personas a las maquiladoras.
texts.en:
Lucina M. E. has had a grocery store called “Miscelánea M.” for the last three years. She offers the best products at low prices. In order to continue to have her store stocked with a wide variety of goods she needs a loan to buy more merchandise so that customers will continue to patronize her and leave satisfied with their purchases. Her husband helps her out economically. Besides being retired, he also works as an assembly plant employee bus driver.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Mame Coumba

texts.fr:
Madame Mame Coumba  S. habite a la cite Fadia  2 une des cites environnantes de la localité  de Guediawaye. Elle  est âgée de 32 ans et est mère de 2 enfants. 
Elle a démarré  l’activité  de vente de petit déjeuner  en s’associant avec une de ses  copines. Par la suite elle s’est retrouvée seule dans la gestion de cette activité.Depuis 2 ans elle s'adonne a la vente de petit dejeuner et de dinner a la patte D'oie. Par conséquent  elle se trouve confrontée à un besoin de financement pour développer  son activité. Et c’est la raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un crédit de 50 000 frs. Madame S. est membre de la caisse depuis un an et n’a jamais contracté  de prêts.
Son objectif est de soutenir son mari à supporter les dépenses  quotidiennes de même que la location  et ceci grâce  a ses bénéfices  dans le but  de maintenir leur équilibre social.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mame Coumba S. lives in the city of Fadia 2, one of the neighboring cities of Guediawaye. She is 32 years old and the mother of two. She started selling breakfast when she joined up with one of her friends. Soon after, she ended up doing it alone. For 2 years, she has been devoting all of her time to selling breakfast and dinner. She thus finds herself in need of financing to develop her business. This is the reason why she seeks a loan of 50,000 frs. Mrs. S. has been a member of the bank for a year and has never taken a loan. Her goal is to help her husband with the daily expenses and rent to be able to maintain their social balance.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: María Del Pilar

texts.es:
